00149 void CDXUTDialog::SetCallback( PCALLBACKDXUTGUIEVENT pCallback, void* pUserContext )
00150 {
00151     // If this assert triggers, you need to call CDXUTDialog::Init() first.  This change
00152     // was made so that the DXUT's GUI could become seperate and optional from DXUT's core.  The 
00153     // creation and interfacing with CDXUTDialogResourceManager is now the responsibility 
00154     // of the application if it wishes to use DXUT's GUI.

00162 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00163 void CDXUTDialog::RemoveControl( int ID )
00164 {
00165     for( int i=0; i < m_Controls.GetSize(); i++ )
00166     {
00167         CDXUTControl* pControl = m_Controls.GetAt( i );
00168         if( pControl->GetID() == ID )
00169         {
00170             // Clean focus first
00171             ClearFocus();
00172 
00173             // Clear references to this control
00174             if( s_pControlFocus == pControl )
00175                 s_pControlFocus = NULL;
00176             if( s_pControlPressed == pControl )
00177                 s_pControlPressed = NULL;
00178             if( m_pControlMouseOver == pControl )
00179                 m_pControlMouseOver = NULL;
00180 
00181             SAFE_DELETE( pControl );
00182             m_Controls.Remove( i );
00183 
00184             return;
00185         }
00186     }
00187 }

00190 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00191 void CDXUTDialog::RemoveAllControls()
00192 {
00193     if( s_pControlFocus && s_pControlFocus->m_pDialog == this )
00194         s_pControlFocus = NULL;
00195     if( s_pControlPressed && s_pControlPressed->m_pDialog == this )
00196         s_pControlPressed = NULL;
00197     m_pControlMouseOver = NULL;
00198 
00199     for( int i=0; i < m_Controls.GetSize(); i++ )
00200     {
00201         CDXUTControl* pControl = m_Controls.GetAt( i );
00202         SAFE_DELETE( pControl );
00203     }
00204 
00205     m_Controls.RemoveAll();
00206 }

00241 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00242 HRESULT CDXUTDialogResourceManager::OnCreateDevice( LPDIRECT3DDEVICE9 pd3dDevice )
00243 {
00244     HRESULT hr = S_OK;
00245     int i=0;
00246 
00247     m_pd3dDevice = pd3dDevice;
00248     
00249     for( i=0; i < m_FontCache.GetSize(); i++ )
00250     {
00251         hr = CreateFont( i );
00252         if( FAILED(hr) )
00253             return hr;
00254     }
00255     
00256     for( i=0; i < m_TextureCache.GetSize(); i++ )
00257     {
00258         hr = CreateTexture( i );
00259         if( FAILED(hr) )
00260             return hr;
00261     }
00262 
00263     hr = D3DXCreateSprite( pd3dDevice, &m_pSprite );
00264     if( FAILED(hr) )
00265         return DXUT_ERR( L"D3DXCreateSprite", hr );
00266 
00267     // Call CDXUTIMEEditBox's StaticOnCreateDevice()
00268     // to initialize certain window-dependent data.
00269     CDXUTIMEEditBox::StaticOnCreateDevice();
00270 
00271     return S_OK;
00272 }

00275 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00276 HRESULT CDXUTDialogResourceManager::OnResetDevice()
00277 {
00278     HRESULT hr = S_OK;
00279 
00280     for( int i=0; i < m_FontCache.GetSize(); i++ )
00281     {
00282         DXUTFontNode* pFontNode = m_FontCache.GetAt( i );
00283 
00284         if( pFontNode->pFont )
00285             pFontNode->pFont->OnResetDevice();
00286     }
00287 
00288     if( m_pSprite )
00289         m_pSprite->OnResetDevice();
00290 
00291     IDirect3DDevice9* pd3dDevice = DXUTGetD3DDevice();
00292 
00293     V_RETURN( pd3dDevice->CreateStateBlock( D3DSBT_ALL, &m_pStateBlock ) );
00294 
00295     return S_OK;
00296 }

00299 bool CDXUTDialogResourceManager::MsgProc( HWND hWnd, UINT uMsg, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam )
00300 {
00301     // Let the CDXUTIMEEditBox's static message proc handle the msg.
00302     // This is because some IME messages must be handled to ensure
00303     // proper functionalities and the static msg proc ensures that
00304     // this happens even if no control has the input focus.
00305     if( CDXUTIMEEditBox::StaticMsgProc( uMsg, wParam, lParam ) )
00306         return true;
00307 
00308     return false;
00309 }

00313 void CDXUTDialogResourceManager::OnLostDevice()

00317         DXUTFontNode* pFontNode = m_FontCache.GetAt( i );

00330 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00331 void CDXUTDialogResourceManager::OnDestroyDevice()
00332 {
00333     int i=0; 
00334 
00335     m_pd3dDevice = NULL;
00336 
00337     // Release the resources but don't clear the cache, as these will need to be
00338     // recreated if the device is recreated
00339     for( i=0; i < m_FontCache.GetSize(); i++ )
00340     {
00341         DXUTFontNode* pFontNode = m_FontCache.GetAt( i );
00342         SAFE_RELEASE( pFontNode->pFont );
00343     }
00344     
00345     for( i=0; i < m_TextureCache.GetSize(); i++ )
00346     {
00347         DXUTTextureNode* pTextureNode = m_TextureCache.GetAt( i );
00348         SAFE_RELEASE( pTextureNode->pTexture );
00349     }
00350 
00351     SAFE_RELEASE( m_pSprite );
00352 }

00356 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00357 bool CDXUTDialogResourceManager::RegisterDialog( CDXUTDialog *pDialog )
00358 {
00359     // Check that the dialog isn't already registered.
00360     for( int i = 0; i < m_Dialogs.GetSize(); ++i )
00361         if( m_Dialogs.GetAt( i ) == pDialog )
00362             return true;
00363 
00364     // Add to the list.
00365     if( FAILED( m_Dialogs.Add( pDialog ) ) )
00366         return false;
00367 
00368     // Set up next and prev pointers.
00369     if( m_Dialogs.GetSize() > 1 )
00370         m_Dialogs[m_Dialogs.GetSize() - 2]->SetNextDialog( pDialog );
00371     m_Dialogs[m_Dialogs.GetSize() - 1]->SetNextDialog( m_Dialogs[0] );
00372 
00373     return true;
00374 }
00375 
00376 
00377 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00378 void CDXUTDialogResourceManager::UnregisterDialog( CDXUTDialog *pDialog )
00379 {
00380     // Search for the dialog in the list.
00381     for( int i = 0; i < m_Dialogs.GetSize(); ++i )
00382         if( m_Dialogs.GetAt( i ) == pDialog )
00383         {
00384             m_Dialogs.Remove( i );
00385             if( m_Dialogs.GetSize() > 0 )
00386             {
00387                 int l, r;
00388 
00389                 if( 0 == i )
00390                     l = m_Dialogs.GetSize() - 1;
00391                 else
00392                     l = i - 1;
00393 
00394                 if( m_Dialogs.GetSize() == i )
00395                     r = 0;
00396                 else
00397                     r = i;
00398 
00399                 m_Dialogs[l]->SetNextDialog( m_Dialogs[r] );
00400             }
00401             return;
00402         }
00403 }

00415 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00416 void CDXUTDialog::Refresh()
00417 {
00418     if( s_pControlFocus )
00419         s_pControlFocus->OnFocusOut();
00420 
00421     if( m_pControlMouseOver )
00422         m_pControlMouseOver->OnMouseLeave();
00423 
00424     s_pControlFocus = NULL;
00425     s_pControlPressed = NULL;
00426     m_pControlMouseOver = NULL;
00427 
00428     for( int i=0; i < m_Controls.GetSize(); i++ )
00429     {
00430         CDXUTControl* pControl = m_Controls.GetAt(i);
00431         pControl->Refresh();
00432     }
00433 
00434     if( m_bKeyboardInput )
00435         FocusDefaultControl();
00436 }

00439 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00440 HRESULT CDXUTDialog::OnRender( float fElapsedTime )
00441 {   
00442     // If this assert triggers, you need to call CDXUTDialogResourceManager::On*Device() from inside
00443     // the application's device callbacks.  See the SDK samples for an example of how to do this.
00444     assert( m_pManager->GetD3DDevice() && m_pManager->m_pStateBlock && L"To fix hook up CDXUTDialogResourceManager to device callbacks.  See comments for details" );
00445 
00446     // See if the dialog needs to be refreshed
00447     if( m_fTimeLastRefresh < s_fTimeRefresh )
00448     {
00449         m_fTimeLastRefresh = DXUTGetTime();
00450         Refresh();
00451     }
00452 
00453     // For invisible dialog, out now.
00454     if( !m_bVisible )
00455         return S_OK;
00456 
00457     DXUT_SCREEN_VERTEX vertices[4] =
00458     {
00459         (float)m_x,           (float)m_y,            0.5f, 1.0f, m_colorTopLeft, 0.0f, 0.5f, 
00460         (float)m_x + m_width, (float)m_y,            0.5f, 1.0f, m_colorTopRight, 1.0f, 0.5f,
00461         (float)m_x + m_width, (float)m_y + m_height, 0.5f, 1.0f, m_colorBottomRight, 1.0f, 1.0f, 
00462         (float)m_x,           (float)m_y + m_height, 0.5f, 1.0f, m_colorBottomLeft, 0.0f, 1.0f, 
00463     };
00464 
00465     IDirect3DDevice9* pd3dDevice = m_pManager->GetD3DDevice();     
00466 
00467     // Set up a state block here and restore it when finished drawing all the controls
00468     m_pManager->m_pStateBlock->Capture();
00469 
00470     pd3dDevice->SetRenderState( D3DRS_ALPHABLENDENABLE, TRUE );
00471     pd3dDevice->SetRenderState( D3DRS_SRCBLEND, D3DBLEND_SRCALPHA );
00472     pd3dDevice->SetRenderState( D3DRS_DESTBLEND, D3DBLEND_INVSRCALPHA );
00473     pd3dDevice->SetRenderState( D3DRS_ALPHATESTENABLE, FALSE );
00474 
00475     pd3dDevice->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_COLOROP, D3DTOP_SELECTARG2 );
00476     pd3dDevice->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_COLORARG2, D3DTA_DIFFUSE );
00477 
00478     pd3dDevice->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_ALPHAOP, D3DTOP_SELECTARG1 );
00479     pd3dDevice->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_ALPHAARG1, D3DTA_DIFFUSE );
00480 
00481     pd3dDevice->SetVertexShader( NULL );
00482     pd3dDevice->SetPixelShader( NULL );
00483 
00484     //pd3dDevice->Clear( 0, NULL, D3DCLEAR_ZBUFFER, 0, 1.0f, 0 );
00485     pd3dDevice->SetRenderState( D3DRS_ZENABLE, FALSE );
00486 
00487     if( !m_bMinimized )
00488     {
00489         pd3dDevice->SetFVF( DXUT_SCREEN_VERTEX::FVF );
00490         pd3dDevice->DrawPrimitiveUP( D3DPT_TRIANGLEFAN, 2, vertices, sizeof(DXUT_SCREEN_VERTEX) );
00491     }
00492 
00493 
00494     pd3dDevice->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_COLOROP, D3DTOP_MODULATE );
00495     pd3dDevice->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_COLORARG1, D3DTA_TEXTURE );
00496     pd3dDevice->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_COLORARG2, D3DTA_DIFFUSE );
00497     
00498     pd3dDevice->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_ALPHAOP, D3DTOP_MODULATE );
00499     pd3dDevice->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_ALPHAARG1, D3DTA_TEXTURE );
00500     pd3dDevice->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_ALPHAARG2, D3DTA_DIFFUSE );
00501 
00502     pd3dDevice->SetSamplerState( 0, D3DSAMP_MINFILTER, D3DTEXF_LINEAR );
00503 
00504     DXUTTextureNode* pTextureNode = GetTexture( 0 );
00505     pd3dDevice->SetTexture( 0, pTextureNode->pTexture );
00506 
00507     m_pManager->m_pSprite->Begin( D3DXSPRITE_DONOTSAVESTATE );
00508 
00509     // Render the caption if it's enabled.
00510     if( m_bCaption )
00511     {
00512         // DrawSprite will offset the rect down by
00513         // m_nCaptionHeight, so adjust the rect higher
00514         // here to negate the effect.
00515         RECT rc = { 0, -m_nCaptionHeight, m_width, 0 };
00516         DrawSprite( &m_CapElement, &rc );
00517         rc.left += 5; // Make a left margin
00518         WCHAR wszOutput[256];
00519         StringCchCopy( wszOutput, 256, m_wszCaption );
00520         if( m_bMinimized )
00521             StringCchCat( wszOutput, 256, L" (Minimized)" );
00522         DrawText( wszOutput, &m_CapElement, &rc, true );
00523     }
00524 
00525     // If the dialog is minimized, skip rendering
00526     // its controls.
00527     if( !m_bMinimized )
00528     {
00529         for( int i=0; i < m_Controls.GetSize(); i++ )
00530         {
00531             CDXUTControl* pControl = m_Controls.GetAt(i);   
00532 
00533             // Focused control is drawn last
00534             if( pControl == s_pControlFocus )
00535                 continue;
00536 
00537             pControl->Render( pd3dDevice, fElapsedTime );
00538         }
00539 
00540         if( s_pControlFocus != NULL && s_pControlFocus->m_pDialog == this )
00541             s_pControlFocus->Render( pd3dDevice, fElapsedTime );
00542     }
00543 
00544     m_pManager->m_pSprite->End();
00545 
00546     m_pManager->m_pStateBlock->Apply();
00547 
00548     return S_OK;
00549 }

00552 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00553 VOID CDXUTDialog::SendEvent( UINT nEvent, bool bTriggeredByUser, CDXUTControl* pControl )
00554 {
00555     // If no callback has been registered there's nowhere to send the event to
00556     if( m_pCallbackEvent == NULL )
00557         return;
00558 
00559     // Discard events triggered programatically if these types of events haven't been
00560     // enabled
00561     if( !bTriggeredByUser && !m_bNonUserEvents )
00562         return;
00563 
00564     m_pCallbackEvent( nEvent, pControl->GetID(), pControl, m_pCallbackEventUserContext );
00565 }

00568 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00569 int CDXUTDialogResourceManager::AddFont( LPCWSTR strFaceName, LONG height, LONG weight )
00570 {
00571     // See if this font already exists
00572     for( int i=0; i < m_FontCache.GetSize(); i++ )
00573     {
00574         DXUTFontNode* pFontNode = m_FontCache.GetAt(i);
00575         if( 0 == _wcsnicmp( pFontNode->strFace, strFaceName, MAX_PATH-1 ) &&
00576             pFontNode->nHeight == height &&
00577             pFontNode->nWeight == weight )
00578         {
00579             return i;
00580         }
00581     }
00582 
00583     // Add a new font and try to create it
00584     DXUTFontNode* pNewFontNode = DX_NEW DXUTFontNode;
00585     if( pNewFontNode == NULL )
00586         return -1;
00587 
00588     ZeroMemory( pNewFontNode, sizeof(DXUTFontNode) );
00589     StringCchCopy( pNewFontNode->strFace, MAX_PATH, strFaceName );
00590     pNewFontNode->nHeight = height;
00591     pNewFontNode->nWeight = weight;
00592     m_FontCache.Add( pNewFontNode );
00593     
00594     int iFont = m_FontCache.GetSize()-1;
00595 
00596     // If a device is available, try to create immediately
00597     if( m_pd3dDevice )
00598         CreateFont( iFont );
00599 
00600     return iFont;
00601 }

00604 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00605 HRESULT CDXUTDialog::SetFont( UINT index, LPCWSTR strFaceName, LONG height, LONG weight )
00606 {
00607     // If this assert triggers, you need to call CDXUTDialog::Init() first.  This change
00608     // was made so that the DXUT's GUI could become seperate and optional from DXUT's core.  The 
00609     // creation and interfacing with CDXUTDialogResourceManager is now the responsibility 
00610     // of the application if it wishes to use DXUT's GUI.
00611     assert( m_pManager != NULL && L"To fix call CDXUTDialog::Init() first.  See comments for details." ); 
00612 
00613     // Make sure the list is at least as large as the index being set
00614     UINT i;
00615     for( i=m_Fonts.GetSize(); i <= index; i++ )
00616     {
00617         m_Fonts.Add( -1 );
00618     }
00619 
00620     int iFont = m_pManager->AddFont( strFaceName, height, weight );
00621     m_Fonts.SetAt( index, iFont );
00622 
00623     return S_OK;
00624 }
00625

00627 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00628 DXUTFontNode* CDXUTDialog::GetFont( UINT index )
00629 {
00630     if( NULL == m_pManager )
00631         return NULL;
00632     return m_pManager->GetFontNode( m_Fonts.GetAt( index ) );
00633 }

00636 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00637 int CDXUTDialogResourceManager::AddTexture( LPCWSTR strFilename )
00638 {
00639     // See if this texture already exists
00640     for( int i=0; i < m_TextureCache.GetSize(); i++ )
00641     {
00642         DXUTTextureNode* pTextureNode = m_TextureCache.GetAt(i);
00643         if( 0 == _wcsnicmp( pTextureNode->strFilename, strFilename, MAX_PATH-1 ) )
00644         {
00645             return i;
00646         }
00647     }
00648 
00649     // Add a new texture and try to create it
00650     DXUTTextureNode* pNewTextureNode = new DXUTTextureNode();
00651     if( pNewTextureNode == NULL )
00652         return -1;
00653 
00654     ZeroMemory( pNewTextureNode, sizeof(DXUTTextureNode) );
00655     StringCchCopy( pNewTextureNode->strFilename, MAX_PATH, strFilename );
00656     m_TextureCache.Add( pNewTextureNode );
00657     
00658     int iTexture = m_TextureCache.GetSize()-1;
00659 
00660     // If a device is available, try to create immediately
00661     if( m_pd3dDevice )
00662         CreateTexture( iTexture );
00663 
00664     return iTexture;
00665 }
00666 
00667 
00668 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00669 HRESULT CDXUTDialog::SetTexture( UINT index, LPCWSTR strFilename )
00670 {
00671     // If this assert triggers, you need to call CDXUTDialog::Init() first.  This change
00672     // was made so that the DXUT's GUI could become seperate and optional from DXUT's core.  The 
00673     // creation and interfacing with CDXUTDialogResourceManager is now the responsibility 
00674     // of the application if it wishes to use DXUT's GUI.
00675     assert( m_pManager != NULL && L"To fix call CDXUTDialog::Init() first.  See comments for details." ); 
00676 
00677     // Make sure the list is at least as large as the index being set
00678     for( UINT i=m_Textures.GetSize(); i <= index; i++ )
00679     {
00680         m_Textures.Add( -1 );
00681     }
00682 
00683     int iTexture = m_pManager->AddTexture( strFilename );
00684 
00685     m_Textures.SetAt( index, iTexture );
00686     return S_OK;
00687 }
00688 
00689 
00690 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00691 DXUTTextureNode* CDXUTDialog::GetTexture( UINT index )
00692 {
00693     if( NULL == m_pManager )
00694         return NULL;
00695     return m_pManager->GetTextureNode( m_Textures.GetAt( index ) );
00696 }

00698 
00699 
00700 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00701 bool CDXUTDialog::MsgProc( HWND hWnd, UINT uMsg, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam )
00702 {
00703     bool bHandled = false;
00704 
00705     // For invisible dialog, do not handle anything.
00706     if( !m_bVisible )
00707         return false;
00708 
00709     // If automation command-line switch is on, enable this dialog's keyboard input
00710     // upon any key press or mouse click.
00711     if( DXUTGetAutomation() &&
00712         ( WM_LBUTTONDOWN == uMsg || WM_LBUTTONDBLCLK == uMsg || WM_KEYDOWN == uMsg ) )
00713     {
00714         m_pManager->EnableKeyboardInputForAllDialogs();
00715     }
00716 
00717     // If caption is enable, check for clicks in the caption area.
00718     if( m_bCaption )
00719     {
00720         static bool bDrag;
00721 
00722         if( uMsg == WM_LBUTTONDOWN || uMsg == WM_LBUTTONDBLCLK )
00723         {
00724             POINT mousePoint = { short(LOWORD(lParam)), short(HIWORD(lParam)) };
00725 
00726             if( mousePoint.x >= m_x && mousePoint.x < m_x + m_width &&
00727                 mousePoint.y >= m_y && mousePoint.y < m_y + m_nCaptionHeight )
00728             {
00729                 bDrag = true;
00730                 SetCapture( DXUTGetHWND() );
00731                 return true;
00732             }
00733         } else
00734         if( uMsg == WM_LBUTTONUP && bDrag )
00735         {
00736             POINT mousePoint = { short(LOWORD(lParam)), short(HIWORD(lParam)) };
00737 
00738             if( mousePoint.x >= m_x && mousePoint.x < m_x + m_width &&
00739                 mousePoint.y >= m_y && mousePoint.y < m_y + m_nCaptionHeight )
00740             {
00741                 ReleaseCapture();
00742                 bDrag = false;
00743                 m_bMinimized = !m_bMinimized;
00744                 return true;
00745             }
00746         }
00747     }
00748 
00749     // If the dialog is minimized, don't send any messages to controls.
00750     if( m_bMinimized )
00751         return false;
00752 
00753     // If a control is in focus, it belongs to this dialog, and it's enabled, then give
00754     // it the first chance at handling the message.
00755     if( s_pControlFocus && 
00756         s_pControlFocus->m_pDialog == this && 
00757         s_pControlFocus->GetEnabled() )
00758     {
00759         // If the control MsgProc handles it, then we don't.
00760         if( s_pControlFocus->MsgProc( uMsg, wParam, lParam ) )
00761             return true;
00762     }
00763 
00764     switch( uMsg )
00765     {
00766         case WM_SIZE:
00767         case WM_MOVE:
00768         {
00769             // Handle sizing and moving messages so that in case the mouse cursor is moved out
00770             // of an UI control because of the window adjustment, we can properly
00771             // unhighlight the highlighted control.
00772             POINT pt = { -1, -1 };
00773             OnMouseMove( pt );
00774             break;
00775         }
00776 
00777         case WM_ACTIVATEAPP:
00778             // Call OnFocusIn()/OnFocusOut() of the control that currently has the focus
00779             // as the application is activated/deactivated.  This matches the Windows
00780             // behavior.
00781             if( s_pControlFocus && 
00782                 s_pControlFocus->m_pDialog == this && 
00783                 s_pControlFocus->GetEnabled() )
00784             {
00785                 if( wParam )
00786                     s_pControlFocus->OnFocusIn();
00787                 else
00788                     s_pControlFocus->OnFocusOut();
00789             }
00790             break;
00791 
00792         // Keyboard messages
00793         case WM_KEYDOWN:
00794         case WM_SYSKEYDOWN:
00795         case WM_KEYUP:
00796         case WM_SYSKEYUP:
00797         {
00798             // If a control is in focus, it belongs to this dialog, and it's enabled, then give
00799             // it the first chance at handling the message.
00800             if( s_pControlFocus && 
00801                 s_pControlFocus->m_pDialog == this && 
00802                 s_pControlFocus->GetEnabled() )
00803             {
00804                 if( s_pControlFocus->HandleKeyboard( uMsg, wParam, lParam ) )
00805                     return true;
00806             }
00807 
00808             // Not yet handled, see if this matches a control's hotkey
00809             // Activate the hotkey if the focus doesn't belong to an
00810             // edit box.
00811             if( uMsg == WM_KEYDOWN && ( !s_pControlFocus ||
00812                                       ( s_pControlFocus->GetType() != DXUT_CONTROL_EDITBOX
00813                                      && s_pControlFocus->GetType() != DXUT_CONTROL_IMEEDITBOX ) ) )
00814             {
00815                 for( int i=0; i < m_Controls.GetSize(); i++ )
00816                 {
00817                     CDXUTControl* pControl = m_Controls.GetAt( i );
00818                     if( pControl->GetHotkey() == wParam )
00819                     {
00820                         pControl->OnHotkey();
00821                         return true;
00822                     }
00823                 }
00824             }
00825 
00826             // Not yet handled, check for focus messages
00827             if( uMsg == WM_KEYDOWN )
00828             {
00829                 // If keyboard input is not enabled, this message should be ignored
00830                 if( !m_bKeyboardInput )
00831                     return false;
00832 
00833                 switch( wParam )
00834                 {
00835                     case VK_RIGHT:
00836                     case VK_DOWN:
00837                         if( s_pControlFocus != NULL )
00838                         {
00839                             return OnCycleFocus( true );
00840                         }
00841                         break;
00842 
00843                     case VK_LEFT:
00844                     case VK_UP:
00845                         if( s_pControlFocus != NULL )
00846                         {
00847                             return OnCycleFocus( false );
00848                         }
00849                         break;
00850 
00851                     case VK_TAB: 
00852                     {
00853                         bool bShiftDown = ((GetKeyState( VK_SHIFT ) & 0x8000) != 0);
00854                         return OnCycleFocus( !bShiftDown );
00855                     }
00856                 }
00857             }
00858 
00859             break;
00860         }
00861 
00862 
00863         // Mouse messages
00864         case WM_MOUSEMOVE:
00865         case WM_LBUTTONDOWN:
00866         case WM_LBUTTONUP:
00867         case WM_MBUTTONDOWN:
00868         case WM_MBUTTONUP:
00869         case WM_RBUTTONDOWN:
00870         case WM_RBUTTONUP:
00871         case WM_XBUTTONDOWN:
00872         case WM_XBUTTONUP:
00873         case WM_LBUTTONDBLCLK:
00874         case WM_MBUTTONDBLCLK:
00875         case WM_RBUTTONDBLCLK:
00876         case WM_XBUTTONDBLCLK:
00877         case WM_MOUSEWHEEL:
00878         {
00879             // If not accepting mouse input, return false to indicate the message should still 
00880             // be handled by the application (usually to move the camera).
00881             if( !m_bMouseInput )
00882                 return false;
00883 
00884             POINT mousePoint = { short(LOWORD(lParam)), short(HIWORD(lParam)) };
00885             mousePoint.x -= m_x;
00886             mousePoint.y -= m_y;
00887 
00888             // If caption is enabled, offset the Y coordinate by the negative of its height.
00889             if( m_bCaption )
00890                 mousePoint.y -= m_nCaptionHeight;
00891 
00892             // If a control is in focus, it belongs to this dialog, and it's enabled, then give
00893             // it the first chance at handling the message.
00894             if( s_pControlFocus && 
00895                 s_pControlFocus->m_pDialog == this && 
00896                 s_pControlFocus->GetEnabled() )
00897             {
00898                 if( s_pControlFocus->HandleMouse( uMsg, mousePoint, wParam, lParam ) )
00899                     return true;
00900             }
00901 
00902             // Not yet handled, see if the mouse is over any controls
00903             CDXUTControl* pControl = GetControlAtPoint( mousePoint );
00904             if( pControl != NULL && pControl->GetEnabled() )
00905             {
00906                 bHandled = pControl->HandleMouse( uMsg, mousePoint, wParam, lParam );
00907                 if( bHandled )
00908                     return true;
00909             }
00910             else
00911             {
00912                 // Mouse not over any controls in this dialog, if there was a control
00913                 // which had focus it just lost it
00914                 if( uMsg == WM_LBUTTONDOWN && 
00915                     s_pControlFocus && 
00916                     s_pControlFocus->m_pDialog == this )
00917                 {
00918                     s_pControlFocus->OnFocusOut();
00919                     s_pControlFocus = NULL;
00920                 }
00921             }
00922 
00923             // Still not handled, hand this off to the dialog. Return false to indicate the
00924             // message should still be handled by the application (usually to move the camera).
00925             switch( uMsg )
00926             {
00927                 case WM_MOUSEMOVE:
00928                     OnMouseMove( mousePoint );
00929                     return false;
00930             }
00931 
00932             break;
00933         }
00934     }
00935 
00936     return false;
00937 }
00938 
00939 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00940 CDXUTControl* CDXUTDialog::GetControlAtPoint( POINT pt )
00941 {
00942     // Search through all child controls for the first one which
00943     // contains the mouse point
00944     for( int i=0; i < m_Controls.GetSize(); i++ )
00945     {
00946         CDXUTControl* pControl = m_Controls.GetAt(i);
00947 
00948         if( pControl == NULL )
00949         {
00950             continue;
00951         }
00952 
00953         // We only return the current control if it is visible
00954         // and enabled.  Because GetControlAtPoint() is used to do mouse
00955         // hittest, it makes sense to perform this filtering.
00956         if( pControl->ContainsPoint( pt ) && pControl->GetEnabled() && pControl->GetVisible() )
00957         {
00958             return pControl;
00959         }
00960     }
00961 
00962     return NULL;
00963 }
00964

00967 bool CDXUTDialog::GetControlEnabled( int ID )
00968 {
00969     CDXUTControl* pControl = GetControl( ID );
00970     if( pControl == NULL )
00971         return false;
00972 
00973     return pControl->GetEnabled();
00974 }

00989 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00990 void CDXUTDialog::OnMouseUp( POINT pt )
00991 {
00992     s_pControlPressed = NULL;
00993     m_pControlMouseOver = NULL;
00994 }
00995 
00996 
00997 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00998 void CDXUTDialog::OnMouseMove( POINT pt )
00999 {
01000     // Figure out which control the mouse is over now
01001     CDXUTControl* pControl = GetControlAtPoint( pt );
01002 
01003     // If the mouse is still over the same control, nothing needs to be done
01004     if( pControl == m_pControlMouseOver )
01005         return;
01006 
01007     // Handle mouse leaving the old control
01008     if( m_pControlMouseOver )
01009         m_pControlMouseOver->OnMouseLeave();
01010 
01011     // Handle mouse entering the new control
01012     m_pControlMouseOver = pControl;
01013     if( pControl != NULL )
01014         m_pControlMouseOver->OnMouseEnter();
01015 }
01016 
01017 
01018 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01019 HRESULT CDXUTDialog::SetDefaultElement( UINT nControlType, UINT iElement, CDXUTElement* pElement )
01020 {
01021     // If this Element type already exist in the list, simply update the stored Element
01022     for( int i=0; i < m_DefaultElements.GetSize(); i++ )
01023     {
01024         DXUTElementHolder* pElementHolder = m_DefaultElements.GetAt( i );
01025         
01026         if( pElementHolder->nControlType == nControlType &&
01027             pElementHolder->iElement == iElement )
01028         {
01029             pElementHolder->Element = *pElement;
01030             return S_OK;
01031         }
01032     }
01033 
01034     // Otherwise, add a new entry
01035     DXUTElementHolder* pNewHolder;
01036     pNewHolder = DX_NEW DXUTElementHolder;
01037     if( pNewHolder == NULL )
01038         return E_OUTOFMEMORY;
01039 
01040     pNewHolder->nControlType = nControlType;
01041     pNewHolder->iElement = iElement;
01042     pNewHolder->Element = *pElement;
01043 
01044     m_DefaultElements.Add( pNewHolder );
01045     return S_OK;
01046 }
01047 
01048 
01049 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01050 CDXUTElement* CDXUTDialog::GetDefaultElement( UINT nControlType, UINT iElement )
01051 {
01052     for( int i=0; i < m_DefaultElements.GetSize(); i++ )
01053     {
01054         DXUTElementHolder* pElementHolder = m_DefaultElements.GetAt( i );
01055         
01056         if( pElementHolder->nControlType == nControlType &&
01057             pElementHolder->iElement == iElement )
01058         {
01059             return &pElementHolder->Element;
01060         }
01061     }
01062     
01063     return NULL;
01064 }

01069 HRESULT CDXUTDialog::AddStatic( int ID, LPCWSTR strText, int x, int y, int width, int height, bool bIsDefault, CDXUTStatic** ppCreated )
01070 {
01071     HRESULT hr = S_OK;
01072 
01073     CDXUTStatic* pStatic = new CDXUTStatic( this );
01074 
01075     if( ppCreated != NULL )
01076         *ppCreated = pStatic;
01077 
01078     if( pStatic == NULL )
01079         return E_OUTOFMEMORY;
01080 
01081     hr = AddControl( pStatic );
01082     if( FAILED(hr) )
01083         return hr;
01084 
01085     // Set the ID and list index
01086     pStatic->SetID( ID ); 
01087     pStatic->SetText( strText );
01088     pStatic->SetLocation( x, y );
01089     pStatic->SetSize( width, height );
01090     pStatic->m_bIsDefault = bIsDefault;
01091 
01092     return S_OK;
01093 }

01337 
01338 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01339 HRESULT CDXUTDialog::InitControl( CDXUTControl* pControl )
01340 {
01341     HRESULT hr;
01342 
01343     if( pControl == NULL )
01344         return E_INVALIDARG;
01345 
01346     pControl->m_Index = m_Controls.GetSize();
01347     
01348     // Look for a default Element entries
01349     for( int i=0; i < m_DefaultElements.GetSize(); i++ )
01350     {
01351         DXUTElementHolder* pElementHolder = m_DefaultElements.GetAt( i );
01352         if( pElementHolder->nControlType == pControl->GetType() )
01353             pControl->SetElement( pElementHolder->iElement, &pElementHolder->Element );
01354     }
01355 
01356     V_RETURN( pControl->OnInit() );
01357 
01358     return S_OK;
01359 }
01360

01363 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01364 HRESULT CDXUTDialog::AddControl( CDXUTControl* pControl )
01365 {
01366     HRESULT hr = S_OK;
01367 
01368     hr = InitControl( pControl );
01369     if( FAILED(hr) )
01370         return DXTRACE_ERR( L"CDXUTDialog::InitControl", hr );
01371 
01372     // Add to the list
01373     hr = m_Controls.Add( pControl );
01374     if( FAILED(hr) )
01375     {
01376         return DXTRACE_ERR( L"CGrowableArray::Add", hr );
01377     }
01378 
01379     return S_OK;
01380 }

01383 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01384 CDXUTControl* CDXUTDialog::GetControl( int ID )
01385 {
01386     // Try to find the control with the given ID
01387     for( int i=0; i < m_Controls.GetSize(); i++ )
01388     {
01389         CDXUTControl* pControl = m_Controls.GetAt( i );
01390 
01391         if( pControl->GetID() == ID )
01392         {
01393             return pControl;
01394         }
01395     }
01396 
01397     // Not found
01398     return NULL;
01399 }

01403 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01404 CDXUTControl* CDXUTDialog::GetControl( int ID, UINT nControlType )
01405 {
01406     // Try to find the control with the given ID
01407     for( int i=0; i < m_Controls.GetSize(); i++ )
01408     {
01409         CDXUTControl* pControl = m_Controls.GetAt( i );
01410 
01411         if( pControl->GetID() == ID && pControl->GetType() == nControlType )
01412         {
01413             return pControl;
01414         }
01415     }
01416 
01417     // Not found
01418     return NULL;
01419 }

01422 
01423 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01424 CDXUTControl* CDXUTDialog::GetNextControl( CDXUTControl* pControl )
01425 {
01426     int index = pControl->m_Index + 1;
01427 
01428     CDXUTDialog* pDialog = pControl->m_pDialog;
01429 
01430     // Cycle through dialogs in the loop to find the next control. Note
01431     // that if only one control exists in all looped dialogs it will
01432     // be the returned 'next' control.
01433     while( index >= (int) pDialog->m_Controls.GetSize() )
01434     {
01435         pDialog = pDialog->m_pNextDialog;
01436         index = 0;
01437     }
01438 
01439     return pDialog->m_Controls.GetAt( index );
01440 }
01441 
01442 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01443 CDXUTControl* CDXUTDialog::GetPrevControl( CDXUTControl* pControl )
01444 {
01445     int index = pControl->m_Index - 1;
01446 
01447     CDXUTDialog* pDialog = pControl->m_pDialog;
01448     
01449     // Cycle through dialogs in the loop to find the next control. Note
01450     // that if only one control exists in all looped dialogs it will
01451     // be the returned 'previous' control.
01452     while( index < 0 )
01453     {
01454         pDialog = pDialog->m_pPrevDialog;
01455         if( pDialog == NULL )
01456             pDialog = pControl->m_pDialog;
01457 
01458         index = pDialog->m_Controls.GetSize() - 1;
01459     }
01460     
01461     return pDialog->m_Controls.GetAt( index );    
01462 }

01465 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01466 void CDXUTDialog::ClearRadioButtonGroup( UINT nButtonGroup )
01467 {
01468     // Find all radio buttons with the given group number
01469     for( int i=0; i < m_Controls.GetSize(); i++ )
01470     {
01471         CDXUTControl* pControl = m_Controls.GetAt( i );
01472 
01473         if( pControl->GetType() == DXUT_CONTROL_RADIOBUTTON )
01474         {
01475             CDXUTRadioButton* pRadioButton = (CDXUTRadioButton*) pControl;
01476 
01477             if( pRadioButton->GetButtonGroup() == nButtonGroup )
01478                 pRadioButton->SetChecked( false, false );
01479         }
01480     }
01481 }

01498 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01499 void CDXUTDialog::RequestFocus( CDXUTControl* pControl )
01500 {
01501     if( s_pControlFocus == pControl )
01502         return;
01503 
01504     if( !pControl->CanHaveFocus() )
01505         return;
01506 
01507     if( s_pControlFocus )
01508         s_pControlFocus->OnFocusOut();
01509 
01510     pControl->OnFocusIn();
01511     s_pControlFocus = pControl;
01512 }

01514 
01515 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01516 HRESULT CDXUTDialog::DrawRect( RECT* pRect, D3DCOLOR color )
01517 {
01518     RECT rcScreen = *pRect;
01519     OffsetRect( &rcScreen, m_x, m_y );
01520 
01521     // If caption is enabled, offset the Y position by its height.
01522     if( m_bCaption )
01523         OffsetRect( &rcScreen, 0, m_nCaptionHeight );
01524 
01525     DXUT_SCREEN_VERTEX vertices[4] =
01526     {
01527         (float) rcScreen.left -0.5f,  (float) rcScreen.top -0.5f,    0.5f, 1.0f, color, 0, 0,
01528         (float) rcScreen.right -0.5f, (float) rcScreen.top -0.5f,    0.5f, 1.0f, color, 0, 0, 
01529         (float) rcScreen.right -0.5f, (float) rcScreen.bottom -0.5f, 0.5f, 1.0f, color, 0, 0, 
01530         (float) rcScreen.left -0.5f,  (float) rcScreen.bottom -0.5f, 0.5f, 1.0f, color, 0, 0,
01531     };
01532 
01533     IDirect3DDevice9* pd3dDevice = m_pManager->GetD3DDevice();
01534 
01535     // Since we're doing our own drawing here we need to flush the sprites
01536     m_pManager->m_pSprite->Flush();
01537     IDirect3DVertexDeclaration9 *pDecl = NULL;
01538     pd3dDevice->GetVertexDeclaration( &pDecl );  // Preserve the sprite's current vertex decl
01539     pd3dDevice->SetFVF( DXUT_SCREEN_VERTEX::FVF );
01540 
01541     pd3dDevice->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_COLOROP, D3DTOP_SELECTARG2 );
01542     pd3dDevice->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_ALPHAOP, D3DTOP_SELECTARG2 );
01543 
01544     pd3dDevice->DrawPrimitiveUP( D3DPT_TRIANGLEFAN, 2, vertices, sizeof(DXUT_SCREEN_VERTEX) );
01545 
01546     pd3dDevice->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_COLOROP, D3DTOP_MODULATE );
01547     pd3dDevice->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_ALPHAOP, D3DTOP_MODULATE );
01548 
01549     // Restore the vertex decl
01550     pd3dDevice->SetVertexDeclaration( pDecl );
01551     pDecl->Release();
01552 
01553     return S_OK;
01554 }
01555 
01556 
01557 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01558 HRESULT CDXUTDialog::DrawPolyLine( POINT* apPoints, UINT nNumPoints, D3DCOLOR color )
01559 {
01560     DXUT_SCREEN_VERTEX* vertices = DX_NEW DXUT_SCREEN_VERTEX[ nNumPoints ];
01561     if( vertices == NULL )
01562         return E_OUTOFMEMORY;
01563 
01564     DXUT_SCREEN_VERTEX* pVertex = vertices;
01565     POINT* pt = apPoints;
01566     for( UINT i=0; i < nNumPoints; i++ )
01567     {
01568         pVertex->x = m_x + (float) pt->x;
01569         pVertex->y = m_y + (float) pt->y;
01570         pVertex->z = 0.5f;
01571         pVertex->h = 1.0f;
01572         pVertex->color = color;
01573         pVertex->tu = 0.0f;
01574         pVertex->tv = 0.0f;
01575 
01576         pVertex++;
01577         pt++;
01578     }
01579 
01580     IDirect3DDevice9* pd3dDevice = m_pManager->GetD3DDevice();
01581 
01582     // Since we're doing our own drawing here we need to flush the sprites
01583     m_pManager->m_pSprite->Flush();
01584     IDirect3DVertexDeclaration9 *pDecl = NULL;
01585     pd3dDevice->GetVertexDeclaration( &pDecl );  // Preserve the sprite's current vertex decl
01586     pd3dDevice->SetFVF( DXUT_SCREEN_VERTEX::FVF );
01587 
01588     pd3dDevice->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_COLOROP, D3DTOP_SELECTARG2 );
01589     pd3dDevice->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_ALPHAOP, D3DTOP_SELECTARG2 );
01590 
01591     pd3dDevice->DrawPrimitiveUP( D3DPT_LINESTRIP, nNumPoints - 1, vertices, sizeof(DXUT_SCREEN_VERTEX) );
01592 
01593     pd3dDevice->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_COLOROP, D3DTOP_MODULATE );
01594     pd3dDevice->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_ALPHAOP, D3DTOP_MODULATE );
01595 
01596     // Restore the vertex decl
01597     pd3dDevice->SetVertexDeclaration( pDecl );
01598     pDecl->Release();
01599 
01600     SAFE_DELETE_ARRAY( vertices );
01601     return S_OK;
01602 }
01603  
01604 
01605 
01606 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01607 HRESULT CDXUTDialog::DrawSprite( CDXUTElement* pElement, RECT* prcDest )
01608 {
01609     // No need to draw fully transparent layers
01610     if( pElement->TextureColor.Current.a == 0 )
01611         return S_OK;
01612 
01613     RECT rcTexture = pElement->rcTexture;
01614     
01615     RECT rcScreen = *prcDest;
01616     OffsetRect( &rcScreen, m_x, m_y );
01617 
01618     // If caption is enabled, offset the Y position by its height.
01619     if( m_bCaption )
01620         OffsetRect( &rcScreen, 0, m_nCaptionHeight );
01621 
01622     DXUTTextureNode* pTextureNode = GetTexture( pElement->iTexture );
01623     if( pTextureNode == NULL )
01624         return E_FAIL;
01625     
01626     float fScaleX = (float) RectWidth( rcScreen ) / RectWidth( rcTexture );
01627     float fScaleY = (float) RectHeight( rcScreen ) / RectHeight( rcTexture );
01628 
01629     D3DXMATRIXA16 matTransform;
01630     D3DXMatrixScaling( &matTransform, fScaleX, fScaleY, 1.0f );
01631 
01632     m_pManager->m_pSprite->SetTransform( &matTransform );
01633     
01634     D3DXVECTOR3 vPos( (float)rcScreen.left, (float)rcScreen.top, 0.0f );
01635 
01636     vPos.x /= fScaleX;
01637     vPos.y /= fScaleY;
01638 
01639     return m_pManager->m_pSprite->Draw( pTextureNode->pTexture, &rcTexture, NULL, &vPos, pElement->TextureColor.Current );
01640 }
01641

01643 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01644 HRESULT CDXUTDialog::CalcTextRect( LPCWSTR strText, CDXUTElement* pElement, RECT* prcDest, int nCount )
01645 {
01646     HRESULT hr = S_OK;
01647 
01648     DXUTFontNode* pFontNode = GetFont( pElement->iFont );
01649     if( pFontNode == NULL )
01650         return E_FAIL;
01651 
01652     DWORD dwTextFormat = pElement->dwTextFormat | DT_CALCRECT;
01653     // Since we are only computing the rectangle, we don't need a sprite.
01654     hr = pFontNode->pFont->DrawText( NULL, strText, nCount, prcDest, dwTextFormat, pElement->FontColor.Current );
01655     if( FAILED(hr) )
01656         return hr;
01657 
01658     return S_OK;
01659 }
01660 
01661 
01662 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01663 HRESULT CDXUTDialog::DrawText( LPCWSTR strText, CDXUTElement* pElement, RECT* prcDest, bool bShadow, int nCount )
01664 {
01665     HRESULT hr = S_OK;
01666 
01667     // No need to draw fully transparent layers
01668     if( pElement->FontColor.Current.a == 0 )
01669         return S_OK;
01670 
01671     RECT rcScreen = *prcDest;
01672     OffsetRect( &rcScreen, m_x, m_y );
01673 
01674     // If caption is enabled, offset the Y position by its height.
01675     if( m_bCaption )
01676         OffsetRect( &rcScreen, 0, m_nCaptionHeight );
01677 
01678     //debug
01679     //DrawRect( &rcScreen, D3DCOLOR_ARGB(100, 255, 0, 0) );
01680 
01681     D3DXMATRIXA16 matTransform;
01682     D3DXMatrixIdentity( &matTransform );
01683     m_pManager->m_pSprite->SetTransform( &matTransform );
01684 
01685     DXUTFontNode* pFontNode = GetFont( pElement->iFont );
01686     
01687     if( bShadow )
01688     {
01689         RECT rcShadow = rcScreen;
01690         OffsetRect( &rcShadow, 1, 1 );
01691         hr = pFontNode->pFont->DrawText( m_pManager->m_pSprite, strText, nCount, &rcShadow, pElement->dwTextFormat, D3DCOLOR_ARGB(DWORD(pElement->FontColor.Current.a * 255), 0, 0, 0) );
01692         if( FAILED(hr) )
01693             return hr;
01694     }
01695 
01696     hr = pFontNode->pFont->DrawText( m_pManager->m_pSprite, strText, nCount, &rcScreen, pElement->dwTextFormat, pElement->FontColor.Current );
01697     if( FAILED(hr) )
01698         return hr;
01699 
01700     return S_OK;
01701 }

01726 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01727 void CDXUTDialog::ClearFocus()
01728 {
01729     if( s_pControlFocus )
01730     {

01732         s_pControlFocus = NULL;
01733     }
01734 
01735     ReleaseCapture();
01736 }

01739 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01740 void CDXUTDialog::FocusDefaultControl()
01741 {
01742     // Check for default control in this dialog
01743     for( int i=0; i < m_Controls.GetSize(); i++ )
01744     {
01745         CDXUTControl* pControl = m_Controls.GetAt( i );
01746         if( pControl->m_bIsDefault )
01747         {
01748             // Remove focus from the current control
01749             ClearFocus();
01750 
01751             // Give focus to the default control
01752             s_pControlFocus = pControl;
01753             s_pControlFocus->OnFocusIn();
01754             return;
01755         }
01756     }
01757 }
01758 
01759 
01760 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01761 bool CDXUTDialog::OnCycleFocus( bool bForward )
01762 {
01763     CDXUTControl *pControl = NULL;
01764     CDXUTDialog *pDialog = NULL; // pDialog and pLastDialog are used to track wrapping of
01765     CDXUTDialog *pLastDialog;    // focus from first control to last or vice versa.
01766 
01767     if( s_pControlFocus == NULL )
01768     {
01769         // If s_pControlFocus is NULL, we focus the first control of first dialog in
01770         // the case that bForward is true, and focus the last control of last dialog when
01771         // bForward is false.
01772         //
01773         if( bForward )
01774         {
01775             // Search for the first control from the start of the dialog
01776             // array.
01777             for( int d = 0; d < m_pManager->m_Dialogs.GetSize(); ++d )
01778             {
01779                 pDialog = pLastDialog = m_pManager->m_Dialogs.GetAt(d);
01780                 if( pDialog && pDialog->m_Controls.GetSize() > 0 )
01781                 {
01782                     pControl = pDialog->m_Controls.GetAt(0);
01783                     break;
01784                 }
01785             }
01786 
01787             if( !pDialog || !pControl )
01788             {
01789                 // No dialog has been registered yet or no controls have been
01790                 // added to the dialogs. Cannot proceed.
01791                 return true;
01792             }
01793         }
01794         else
01795         {
01796             // Search for the first control from the end of the dialog
01797             // array.
01798             for( int d = m_pManager->m_Dialogs.GetSize() - 1; d >= 0; --d )
01799             {
01800                 pDialog = pLastDialog = m_pManager->m_Dialogs.GetAt(d);
01801                 if( pDialog && pDialog->m_Controls.GetSize() > 0 )
01802                 {
01803                     pControl = pDialog->m_Controls.GetAt( pDialog->m_Controls.GetSize() - 1 );
01804                     break;
01805                 }
01806             }
01807 
01808             if( !pDialog || !pControl )
01809             {
01810                 // No dialog has been registered yet or no controls have been
01811                 // added to the dialogs. Cannot proceed.
01812                 return true;
01813             }
01814         }
01815     }
01816     else
01817     if( s_pControlFocus->m_pDialog != this )
01818     {
01819         // If a control belonging to another dialog has focus, let that other
01820         // dialog handle this event by returning false.
01821         //
01822         return false;
01823     }
01824     else
01825     {
01826         // Focused control belongs to this dialog. Cycle to the
01827         // next/previous control.
01828         pLastDialog = s_pControlFocus->m_pDialog;
01829         pControl = (bForward) ? GetNextControl( s_pControlFocus ) : GetPrevControl( s_pControlFocus );
01830         pDialog = pControl->m_pDialog;
01831     }
01832 
01833     for( int i=0; i < 0xffff; i++ )
01834     {
01835         // If we just wrapped from last control to first or vice versa,
01836         // set the focused control to NULL. This state, where no control
01837         // has focus, allows the camera to work.
01838         int nLastDialogIndex = m_pManager->m_Dialogs.IndexOf( pLastDialog );
01839         int nDialogIndex = m_pManager->m_Dialogs.IndexOf( pDialog );
01840         if( ( !bForward && nLastDialogIndex < nDialogIndex ) ||
01841             ( bForward && nDialogIndex < nLastDialogIndex ) )
01842         {
01843             if( s_pControlFocus )
01844                 s_pControlFocus->OnFocusOut();
01845             s_pControlFocus = NULL;
01846             return true;
01847         }
01848 
01849         // If we've gone in a full circle then focus doesn't change
01850         if( pControl == s_pControlFocus )
01851             return true;
01852 
01853         // If the dialog accepts keybord input and the control can have focus then
01854         // move focus
01855         if( pControl->m_pDialog->m_bKeyboardInput && pControl->CanHaveFocus() )
01856         {
01857             if( s_pControlFocus )
01858                 s_pControlFocus->OnFocusOut();
01859             s_pControlFocus = pControl;
01860             s_pControlFocus->OnFocusIn();
01861             return true;
01862         }
01863 
01864         pLastDialog = pDialog;
01865         pControl = (bForward) ? GetNextControl( pControl ) : GetPrevControl( pControl );
01866         pDialog = pControl->m_pDialog;
01867     }
01868 
01869     // If we reached this point, the chain of dialogs didn't form a complete loop
01870     DXTRACE_ERR( L"CDXUTDialog: Multiple dialogs are improperly chained together", E_FAIL );
01871     return false;
01872 }
01873 
01874 
01875 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01876 HRESULT CDXUTDialogResourceManager::CreateFont( UINT iFont )
01877 {
01878     HRESULT hr = S_OK;
01879 
01880     DXUTFontNode* pFontNode = m_FontCache.GetAt( iFont );
01881 
01882     SAFE_RELEASE( pFontNode->pFont );
01883     
01884     V_RETURN( D3DXCreateFont( m_pd3dDevice, pFontNode->nHeight, 0, pFontNode->nWeight, 1, FALSE, DEFAULT_CHARSET, 
01885                               OUT_DEFAULT_PRECIS, DEFAULT_QUALITY, DEFAULT_PITCH | FF_DONTCARE, 
01886                               pFontNode->strFace, &pFontNode->pFont ) );
01887 
01888     return S_OK;
01889 }
01890 
01891 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01892 HRESULT CDXUTDialogResourceManager::CreateTexture( UINT iTexture )
01893 {
01894     HRESULT hr = S_OK;
01895 
01896     DXUTTextureNode* pTextureNode = m_TextureCache.GetAt( iTexture );
01897     
01898     // Make sure there's a texture to create
01899     if( pTextureNode->strFilename[0] == 0 )
01900         return S_OK;
01901     
01902     // Find the texture on the hard drive
01903     WCHAR strPath[MAX_PATH];
01904     hr = DXUTFindDXSDKMediaFileCch( strPath, MAX_PATH, pTextureNode->strFilename );
01905     if( FAILED(hr) )
01906     {
01907         return DXTRACE_ERR( L"DXUTFindDXSDKMediaFileCch", hr );
01908     }
01909 
01910     // Create texture
01911     D3DXIMAGE_INFO info;
01912     hr =  D3DXCreateTextureFromFileEx( m_pd3dDevice, strPath, D3DX_DEFAULT, D3DX_DEFAULT, 
01913                                        1, 0, D3DFMT_UNKNOWN, D3DPOOL_MANAGED, 
01914                                        D3DX_DEFAULT, D3DX_DEFAULT, 0, 
01915                                        &info, NULL, &pTextureNode->pTexture );
01916     if( FAILED(hr) )
01917     {
01918         return DXTRACE_ERR( L"D3DXCreateTextureFromFileEx", hr );
01919     }
01920 
01921     // Store dimensions
01922     pTextureNode->dwWidth = info.Width;
01923     pTextureNode->dwHeight = info.Height;
01924 
01925     return S_OK;
01926 }
01927 
01928 
01929 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01930 void CDXUTDialog::InitDefaultElements()
01931 {
01932     SetTexture( 0, L"data\\DXUTControls.dds" );
01933     SetFont( 0, L"Arial", 14, FW_NORMAL );
01934     
01935     CDXUTElement Element;
01936     RECT rcTexture;
01937 
01938     //-------------------------------------
01939     // Element for the caption
01940     //-------------------------------------
01941     m_CapElement.SetFont( 0 );
01942     SetRect( &rcTexture, 17, 269, 241, 287 );
01943     m_CapElement.SetTexture( 0, &rcTexture );
01944     m_CapElement.TextureColor.States[ DXUT_STATE_NORMAL ] = D3DCOLOR_ARGB(255, 255, 255, 255);
01945     m_CapElement.FontColor.States[ DXUT_STATE_NORMAL ] = D3DCOLOR_ARGB(255, 255, 255, 255);
01946     m_CapElement.SetFont( 0, D3DCOLOR_ARGB(255, 255, 255, 255), DT_LEFT | DT_VCENTER );
01947     // Pre-blend as we don't need to transition the state
01948     m_CapElement.TextureColor.Blend( DXUT_STATE_NORMAL, 10.0f );
01949     m_CapElement.FontColor.Blend( DXUT_STATE_NORMAL, 10.0f );
01950 
01951     //-------------------------------------
01952     // CDXUTStatic
01953     //-------------------------------------
01954     Element.SetFont( 0 );
01955     Element.FontColor.States[ DXUT_STATE_DISABLED ] = D3DCOLOR_ARGB( 200, 200, 200, 200 );
01956 
01957     // Assign the Element
01958     SetDefaultElement( DXUT_CONTROL_STATIC, 0, &Element );
01959     
01960 
01961     //-------------------------------------
01962     // CDXUTButton - Button
01963     //-------------------------------------
01964     SetRect( &rcTexture, 0, 0, 136, 54 );
01965     Element.SetTexture( 0, &rcTexture );
01966     Element.SetFont( 0 );
01967     Element.TextureColor.States[ DXUT_STATE_NORMAL ] = D3DCOLOR_ARGB(150, 255, 255, 255);
01968     Element.TextureColor.States[ DXUT_STATE_PRESSED ] = D3DCOLOR_ARGB(200, 255, 255, 255);
01969     Element.FontColor.States[ DXUT_STATE_MOUSEOVER ] = D3DCOLOR_ARGB(255, 0, 0, 0);
01970     
01971     // Assign the Element
01972     SetDefaultElement( DXUT_CONTROL_BUTTON, 0, &Element );
01973     
01974 
01975     //-------------------------------------
01976     // CDXUTButton - Fill layer
01977     //-------------------------------------

02272 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02273 CDXUTControl::CDXUTControl( CDXUTDialog *pDialog )
02274 {
02275     m_Type = DXUT_CONTROL_BUTTON;
02276     m_pDialog = pDialog;
02277     m_ID = 0;
02278     m_Index = 0;
02279     m_pUserData = NULL;
02280 
02281     m_bEnabled = true;
02282     m_bVisible = true;
02283     m_bMouseOver = false;
02284     m_bHasFocus = false;
02285     m_bIsDefault = false;
02286 
02287     m_pDialog = NULL;
02288 
02289     m_x = 0;
02290     m_y = 0;
02291     m_width = 0;
02292     m_height = 0;
02293 
02294    ZeroMemory( &m_rcBoundingBox, sizeof( m_rcBoundingBox ) );
02295 }
02296 
02297 
02298 CDXUTControl::~CDXUTControl()
02299 {
02300     for( int i = 0; i < m_Elements.GetSize(); ++i )
02301     {
02302         delete m_Elements[i];
02303     }
02304     m_Elements.RemoveAll();
02305 }
02306 
02307 
02308 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02309 void CDXUTControl::SetTextColor( D3DCOLOR Color )
02310 {
02311     CDXUTElement* pElement = m_Elements.GetAt( 0 );
02312 
02313     if( pElement )
02314         pElement->FontColor.States[DXUT_STATE_NORMAL] = Color;
02315 }
02316 
02317 
02318 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02319 HRESULT CDXUTControl::SetElement( UINT iElement, CDXUTElement* pElement )
02320 {
02321     HRESULT hr = S_OK;
02322 
02323     if( pElement == NULL )
02324         return E_INVALIDARG;
02325 
02326     // Make certain the array is this large
02327     for( UINT i=m_Elements.GetSize(); i <= iElement; i++ )
02328     {
02329         CDXUTElement* pNewElement = new CDXUTElement();
02330         if( pNewElement == NULL )
02331             return E_OUTOFMEMORY;
02332 
02333         hr = m_Elements.Add( pNewElement );
02334         if( FAILED(hr) )
02335         {
02336             SAFE_DELETE( pNewElement );
02337             return hr;
02338         }
02339     }
02340 
02341     // Update the data
02342     CDXUTElement* pCurElement = m_Elements.GetAt( iElement );
02343     *pCurElement = *pElement;
02344     
02345     return S_OK;
02346 }
02347 
02348 
02349 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02350 void CDXUTControl::Refresh()
02351 {
02352     m_bMouseOver = false;
02353     m_bHasFocus = false;
02354 
02355     for( int i=0; i < m_Elements.GetSize(); i++ )
02356     {
02357         CDXUTElement* pElement = m_Elements.GetAt( i );
02358         pElement->Refresh();
02359     }
02360 }
02361 
02362 
02363 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02364 void CDXUTControl::UpdateRects()
02365 {
02366     SetRect( &m_rcBoundingBox, m_x, m_y, m_x + m_width, m_y + m_height );
02367 }

02371 // CDXUTStatic class
02372 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02373 
02374 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02375 CDXUTStatic::CDXUTStatic( CDXUTDialog *pDialog )
02376 {
02377     m_Type = DXUT_CONTROL_STATIC;
02378     m_pDialog = pDialog;
02379 
02380     ZeroMemory( &m_strText, sizeof(m_strText) );  
02381 
02382     for( int i=0; i < m_Elements.GetSize(); i++ )
02383     {
02384         CDXUTElement* pElement = m_Elements.GetAt( i );
02385         SAFE_DELETE( pElement );
02386     }
02387 
02388     m_Elements.RemoveAll();
02389 }
02390 
02391 
02392 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02393 void CDXUTStatic::Render( IDirect3DDevice9* pd3dDevice, float fElapsedTime )
02394 {    
02395     if( m_bVisible == false )
02396         return;
02397 
02398     DXUT_CONTROL_STATE iState = DXUT_STATE_NORMAL;
02399 
02400     if( m_bEnabled == false )
02401         iState = DXUT_STATE_DISABLED;
02402         
02403     CDXUTElement* pElement = m_Elements.GetAt( 0 );
02404 
02405     pElement->FontColor.Blend( iState, fElapsedTime );
02406     
02407     m_pDialog->DrawText( m_strText, pElement, &m_rcBoundingBox, true );
02408 }
02409 
02410 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02411 HRESULT CDXUTStatic::GetTextCopy( LPWSTR strDest, UINT bufferCount )
02412 {
02413     // Validate incoming parameters
02414     if( strDest == NULL || bufferCount == 0 )
02415     {
02416         return E_INVALIDARG;
02417     }
02418 
02419     // Copy the window text
02420     StringCchCopy( strDest, bufferCount, m_strText );
02421 
02422     return S_OK;
02423 }
02424 
02425 
02426 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02427 HRESULT CDXUTStatic::SetText( LPCWSTR strText )
02428 {
02429     if( strText == NULL )
02430     {
02431         m_strText[0] = 0;
02432         return S_OK;
02433     }
02434     
02435     StringCchCopy( m_strText, MAX_PATH, strText); 
02436     return S_OK;
02437 }

02440 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02441 // CDXUTButton class
02442 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02443 
02444 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02445 CDXUTButton::CDXUTButton( CDXUTDialog *pDialog )
02446 {
02447     m_Type = DXUT_CONTROL_BUTTON;
02448     m_pDialog = pDialog;
02449 
02450     m_bPressed = false;
02451     m_nHotkey = 0;
02452 }
02453 
02454 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02455 bool CDXUTButton::HandleKeyboard( UINT uMsg, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam )
02456 {
02457     if( !m_bEnabled || !m_bVisible )
02458         return false;
02459 
02460     switch( uMsg )
02461     {
02462         case WM_KEYDOWN:
02463         {
02464             switch( wParam )
02465             {
02466                 case VK_SPACE:
02467                     m_bPressed = true;
02468                     return true;
02469             }
02470         }
02471 
02472         case WM_KEYUP:
02473         {
02474             switch( wParam )
02475             {
02476                 case VK_SPACE:
02477                     if( m_bPressed == true )
02478                     {
02479                         m_bPressed = false;
02480                         m_pDialog->SendEvent( EVENT_BUTTON_CLICKED, true, this );
02481                     }
02482                     return true;
02483             }
02484         }
02485     }
02486     return false;
02487 }
02488 
02489 
02490 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02491 bool CDXUTButton::HandleMouse( UINT uMsg, POINT pt, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam )
02492 {
02493     if( !m_bEnabled || !m_bVisible )
02494         return false;
02495 
02496     switch( uMsg )
02497     {
02498         case WM_LBUTTONDOWN:
02499         case WM_LBUTTONDBLCLK:
02500         {
02501             if( ContainsPoint( pt ) )
02502             {
02503                 // Pressed while inside the control
02504                 m_bPressed = true;
02505                 SetCapture( DXUTGetHWND() );
02506 
02507                 if( !m_bHasFocus )
02508                     m_pDialog->RequestFocus( this );
02509 
02510                 return true;
02511             }
02512 
02513             break;
02514         }
02515 
02516         case WM_LBUTTONUP:
02517         {
02518             if( m_bPressed )
02519             {
02520                 m_bPressed = false;
02521                 ReleaseCapture();
02522 
02523                 if( !m_pDialog->m_bKeyboardInput )
02524                     m_pDialog->ClearFocus();
02525 
02526                 // Button click
02527                 if( ContainsPoint( pt ) )
02528                     m_pDialog->SendEvent( EVENT_BUTTON_CLICKED, true, this );
02529 
02530                 return true;
02531             }
02532 
02533             break;
02534         }
02535     };
02536     
02537     return false;
02538 }
02539 
02540 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02541 void CDXUTButton::Render( IDirect3DDevice9* pd3dDevice, float fElapsedTime )
02542 {
02543     int nOffsetX = 0;
02544     int nOffsetY = 0;
02545 
02546     DXUT_CONTROL_STATE iState = DXUT_STATE_NORMAL;
02547 
02548     if( m_bVisible == false )
02549     {
02550         iState = DXUT_STATE_HIDDEN;
02551     }
02552     else if( m_bEnabled == false )
02553     {
02554         iState = DXUT_STATE_DISABLED;
02555     }
02556     else if( m_bPressed )
02557     {
02558         iState = DXUT_STATE_PRESSED;
02559 
02560         nOffsetX = 1;
02561         nOffsetY = 2;
02562     }
02563     else if( m_bMouseOver )
02564     {
02565         iState = DXUT_STATE_MOUSEOVER;
02566 
02567         nOffsetX = -1;
02568         nOffsetY = -2;
02569     }
02570     else if( m_bHasFocus )
02571     {
02572         iState = DXUT_STATE_FOCUS;
02573     }
02574     
02575     // Background fill layer
02576     //TODO: remove magic numbers
02577     CDXUTElement* pElement = m_Elements.GetAt( 0 );
02578     
02579     float fBlendRate = ( iState == DXUT_STATE_PRESSED ) ? 0.0f : 0.8f;
02580 
02581     RECT rcWindow = m_rcBoundingBox;
02582     OffsetRect( &rcWindow, nOffsetX, nOffsetY );
02583 
02584  
02585     // Blend current color
02586     pElement->TextureColor.Blend( iState, fElapsedTime, fBlendRate );
02587     pElement->FontColor.Blend( iState, fElapsedTime, fBlendRate );
02588 
02589     m_pDialog->DrawSprite( pElement, &rcWindow );
02590     m_pDialog->DrawText( m_strText, pElement, &rcWindow );
02591 
02592     // Main button
02593     pElement = m_Elements.GetAt( 1 );
02594 
02595 
02596     // Blend current color
02597     pElement->TextureColor.Blend( iState, fElapsedTime, fBlendRate );
02598     pElement->FontColor.Blend( iState, fElapsedTime, fBlendRate );
02599 
02600     m_pDialog->DrawSprite( pElement, &rcWindow );
02601     m_pDialog->DrawText( m_strText, pElement, &rcWindow );
02602 }

02619 
02620 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02621 bool CDXUTCheckBox::HandleKeyboard( UINT uMsg, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam )
02622 {
02623     if( !m_bEnabled || !m_bVisible )
02624         return false;
02625 
02626     switch( uMsg )
02627     {
02628         case WM_KEYDOWN:
02629         {
02630             switch( wParam )
02631             {
02632                 case VK_SPACE:
02633                     m_bPressed = true;
02634                     return true;
02635             }
02636         }
02637 
02638         case WM_KEYUP:
02639         {
02640             switch( wParam )
02641             {
02642                 case VK_SPACE:
02643                     if( m_bPressed == true )
02644                     {
02645                         m_bPressed = false;
02646                         SetCheckedInternal( !m_bChecked, true );
02647                     }
02648                     return true;
02649             }
02650         }
02651     }
02652     return false;
02653 }
02654 
02655 
02656 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02657 bool CDXUTCheckBox::HandleMouse( UINT uMsg, POINT pt, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam )
02658 {
02659     if( !m_bEnabled || !m_bVisible )
02660         return false;
02661 
02662     switch( uMsg )
02663     {
02664         case WM_LBUTTONDOWN:
02665         case WM_LBUTTONDBLCLK:
02666         {
02667             if( ContainsPoint( pt ) )
02668             {
02669                 // Pressed while inside the control
02670                 m_bPressed = true;
02671                 SetCapture( DXUTGetHWND() );
02672 
02673                 if( !m_bHasFocus )
02674                     m_pDialog->RequestFocus( this );
02675 
02676                 return true;
02677             }
02678 
02679             break;
02680         }
02681 
02682         case WM_LBUTTONUP:
02683         {
02684             if( m_bPressed )
02685             {
02686                 m_bPressed = false;
02687                 ReleaseCapture();
02688 
02689                 // Button click
02690                 if( ContainsPoint( pt ) )
02691                     SetCheckedInternal( !m_bChecked, true );
02692                 
02693                 return true;
02694             }
02695 
02696             break;
02697         }
02698     };
02699     
02700     return false;
02701 }
02702 
02703 
02704 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02705 void CDXUTCheckBox::SetCheckedInternal( bool bChecked, bool bFromInput ) 
02706 { 
02707     m_bChecked = bChecked; 
02708 
02709     m_pDialog->SendEvent( EVENT_CHECKBOX_CHANGED, bFromInput, this ); 
02710 }
02711 
02712 
02713 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02714 BOOL CDXUTCheckBox::ContainsPoint( POINT pt ) 
02715 { 
02716     return ( PtInRect( &m_rcBoundingBox, pt ) || 
02717              PtInRect( &m_rcButton, pt ) ); 
02718 }
02719 
02720 
02721 
02722 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02723 void CDXUTCheckBox::UpdateRects()
02724 {
02725     CDXUTButton::UpdateRects();
02726 
02727     m_rcButton = m_rcBoundingBox;
02728     m_rcButton.right = m_rcButton.left + RectHeight( m_rcButton );
02729 
02730     m_rcText = m_rcBoundingBox;
02731     m_rcText.left += (int) ( 1.25f * RectWidth( m_rcButton ) );
02732 }
02733 
02734 
02735 
02736 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02737 void CDXUTCheckBox::Render( IDirect3DDevice9* pd3dDevice, float fElapsedTime )
02738 {
02739     DXUT_CONTROL_STATE iState = DXUT_STATE_NORMAL;
02740 
02741     if( m_bVisible == false )
02742         iState = DXUT_STATE_HIDDEN;
02743     else if( m_bEnabled == false )
02744         iState = DXUT_STATE_DISABLED;
02745     else if( m_bPressed )
02746         iState = DXUT_STATE_PRESSED;
02747     else if( m_bMouseOver )
02748         iState = DXUT_STATE_MOUSEOVER;
02749     else if( m_bHasFocus )
02750         iState = DXUT_STATE_FOCUS;
02751 
02752     CDXUTElement* pElement = m_Elements.GetAt( 0 );
02753 
02754     float fBlendRate = ( iState == DXUT_STATE_PRESSED ) ? 0.0f : 0.8f;
02755 
02756     pElement->TextureColor.Blend( iState, fElapsedTime, fBlendRate );
02757     pElement->FontColor.Blend( iState, fElapsedTime, fBlendRate );
02758 
02759     m_pDialog->DrawSprite( pElement, &m_rcButton );
02760     m_pDialog->DrawText( m_strText, pElement, &m_rcText, true );
02761 
02762     if( !m_bChecked )
02763         iState = DXUT_STATE_HIDDEN;
02764 
02765     pElement = m_Elements.GetAt( 1 );
02766 
02767     pElement->TextureColor.Blend( iState, fElapsedTime, fBlendRate );
02768     m_pDialog->DrawSprite( pElement, &m_rcButton );
02769 }

02896 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02897 CDXUTComboBox::CDXUTComboBox( CDXUTDialog *pDialog ) :
02898     m_ScrollBar( pDialog )
02899 {
02900     m_Type = DXUT_CONTROL_COMBOBOX;
02901     m_pDialog = pDialog;
02902 
02903     m_nDropHeight = 100;
02904 
02905     m_nSBWidth = 16;
02906     m_bOpened = false;
02907     m_iSelected = -1;
02908     m_iFocused = -1;
02909 }
02910 
02911 
02912 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02913 CDXUTComboBox::~CDXUTComboBox()
02914 {
02915     RemoveAllItems();
02916 }
02917 
02918 
02919 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02920 void CDXUTComboBox::SetTextColor( D3DCOLOR Color )
02921 {
02922     CDXUTElement* pElement = m_Elements.GetAt( 0 );
02923 
02924     if( pElement )
02925         pElement->FontColor.States[DXUT_STATE_NORMAL] = Color;
02926 
02927     pElement = m_Elements.GetAt( 2 );
02928 
02929     if( pElement )
02930         pElement->FontColor.States[DXUT_STATE_NORMAL] = Color;
02931 }
02932 
02933 
02934 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02935 void CDXUTComboBox::UpdateRects()
02936 {
02937     
02938     CDXUTButton::UpdateRects();
02939 
02940     m_rcButton = m_rcBoundingBox;
02941     m_rcButton.left = m_rcButton.right - RectHeight( m_rcButton );
02942 
02943     m_rcText = m_rcBoundingBox;
02944     m_rcText.right = m_rcButton.left;
02945 
02946     m_rcDropdown = m_rcText;
02947     OffsetRect( &m_rcDropdown, 0, (int) (0.90f * RectHeight( m_rcText )) );
02948     m_rcDropdown.bottom += m_nDropHeight;
02949     m_rcDropdown.right -= m_nSBWidth;
02950 
02951     m_rcDropdownText = m_rcDropdown;
02952     m_rcDropdownText.left += (int) (0.1f * RectWidth( m_rcDropdown ));
02953     m_rcDropdownText.right -= (int) (0.1f * RectWidth( m_rcDropdown ));
02954     m_rcDropdownText.top += (int) (0.1f * RectHeight( m_rcDropdown ));
02955     m_rcDropdownText.bottom -= (int) (0.1f * RectHeight( m_rcDropdown ));
02956 
02957     // Update the scrollbar's rects
02958     m_ScrollBar.SetLocation( m_rcDropdown.right, m_rcDropdown.top+2 );
02959     m_ScrollBar.SetSize( m_nSBWidth, RectHeight( m_rcDropdown )-2 );
02960     DXUTFontNode* pFontNode = m_pDialog->GetManager()->GetFontNode( m_Elements.GetAt( 2 )->iFont );
02961     if( pFontNode && pFontNode->nHeight )
02962     {
02963         m_ScrollBar.SetPageSize( RectHeight( m_rcDropdownText ) / pFontNode->nHeight );
02964 
02965         // The selected item may have been scrolled off the page.
02966         // Ensure that it is in page again.
02967         m_ScrollBar.ShowItem( m_iSelected );
02968     }
02969 }
02970
