05951 
05952 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05953 // Resets the composition string.
05954 void CDXUTIMEEditBox::ResetCompositionString()
05955 {
05956     s_nCompCaret = 0;
05957     s_CompString.SetText( L"" );
05958     ZeroMemory( s_abCompStringAttr, sizeof(s_abCompStringAttr) );
05959 }
05960 
05961 
05962 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05963 // Truncate composition string by sending keystrokes to the window.
05964 void CDXUTIMEEditBox::TruncateCompString( bool bUseBackSpace, int iNewStrLen )
05965 {
05966     if( !s_bInsertOnType )
05967         return;
05968 
05969     int cc = (int) wcslen( s_CompString.GetBuffer() );
05970     assert( iNewStrLen == 0 || iNewStrLen >= cc );
05971 
05972     // Send right arrow keystrokes to move the caret
05973     //   to the end of the composition string.
05974     for (int i = 0; i < cc - s_nCompCaret; ++i )
05975         SendMessage( DXUTGetHWND(), WM_KEYDOWN, VK_RIGHT, 0 );
05976     SendMessage( DXUTGetHWND(), WM_KEYUP, VK_RIGHT, 0 );
05977 
05978     if( bUseBackSpace || m_bInsertMode )
05979         iNewStrLen = 0;
05980 
05981     // The caller sets bUseBackSpace to false if there's possibility of sending
05982     // new composition string to the app right after this function call.
05983     // 
05984     // If the app is in overwriting mode and new comp string is 
05985     // shorter than current one, delete previous comp string 
05986     // till it's same long as the new one. Then move caret to the beginning of comp string.
05987     // New comp string will overwrite old one.
05988     if( iNewStrLen < cc )
05989     {
05990         for( int i = 0; i < cc - iNewStrLen; ++i )
05991         {
05992             SendMessage( DXUTGetHWND(), WM_KEYDOWN, VK_BACK, 0 );  // Backspace character
05993             SendMessageW( DXUTGetHWND(), WM_CHAR, VK_BACK, 0 );
05994         }
05995         SendMessage( DXUTGetHWND(), WM_KEYUP, VK_BACK, 0 );
05996     }
05997     else
05998         iNewStrLen = cc;
05999 
06000     // Move the caret to the beginning by sending left keystrokes
06001     for (int i = 0; i < iNewStrLen; ++i )
06002         SendMessage( DXUTGetHWND(), WM_KEYDOWN, VK_LEFT, 0 );
06003     SendMessage( DXUTGetHWND(), WM_KEYUP, VK_LEFT, 0 );
06004 }
06005 
06006 
06007 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06008 // Sends the current composition string to the application by sending keystroke
06009 // messages.
06010 void CDXUTIMEEditBox::SendCompString()
06011 {
06012     for( int i = 0; i < lstrlen( s_CompString.GetBuffer() ); ++i )
06013         MsgProc( WM_CHAR, (WPARAM)s_CompString[i], 0 );
06014 }
06015 
06016 
06017 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06018 // Outputs current composition string then cleans up the composition task.
06019 void CDXUTIMEEditBox::FinalizeString( bool bSend )
06020 {
06021     HIMC hImc;
06022     if( NULL == ( hImc = _ImmGetContext( DXUTGetHWND() ) ) )
06023         return;
06024 
06025     static bool bProcessing = false;
06026     if( bProcessing )    // avoid infinite recursion
06027     {
06028         DXUTTRACE( L"CDXUTIMEEditBox::FinalizeString: Reentrant detected!\n" );
06029         _ImmReleaseContext( DXUTGetHWND(), hImc );
06030         return;
06031     }
06032     bProcessing = true;
06033 
06034     if( !s_bInsertOnType && bSend )
06035     {
06036         // Send composition string to app.
06037         LONG lLength = lstrlen( s_CompString.GetBuffer() );
06038         // In case of CHT IME, don't send the trailing double byte space, if it exists.
06039         if( GetLanguage() == LANG_CHT
06040             && s_CompString[lLength - 1] == 0x3000 )
06041         {
06042             s_CompString[lLength - 1] = 0;
06043         }
06044         SendCompString();
06045     }
06046 
06047     ResetCompositionString();
06048     // Clear composition string in IME
06049     _ImmNotifyIME( hImc, NI_COMPOSITIONSTR, CPS_CANCEL, 0 );
06050     // the following line is necessary as Korean IME doesn't close cand list
06051     // when comp string is cancelled.
06052     _ImmNotifyIME( hImc, NI_CLOSECANDIDATE, 0, 0 ); 
06053     _ImmReleaseContext( DXUTGetHWND(), hImc );
06054     bProcessing = false;
06055 }
06056 
06057 
06058 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06059 // Determine whether the reading window should be vertical or horizontal.
06060 void CDXUTIMEEditBox::GetReadingWindowOrientation( DWORD dwId )
06061 {
06062     s_bHorizontalReading = ( s_hklCurrent == _CHS_HKL ) || ( s_hklCurrent == _CHT_HKL2 ) || ( dwId == 0 );
06063     if( !s_bHorizontalReading && ( dwId & 0x0000FFFF ) == LANG_CHT )
06064     {
06065         WCHAR wszRegPath[MAX_PATH];
06066         HKEY hKey;
06067         DWORD dwVer = dwId & 0xFFFF0000;
06068         StringCchCopy( wszRegPath, MAX_PATH, L"software\\microsoft\\windows\\currentversion\\" );
06069         StringCchCat( wszRegPath, MAX_PATH, ( dwVer >= MAKEIMEVERSION( 5, 1 ) ) ? L"MSTCIPH" : L"TINTLGNT" );
06070         LONG lRc = RegOpenKeyExW( HKEY_CURRENT_USER, wszRegPath, 0, KEY_READ, &hKey );
06071         if (lRc == ERROR_SUCCESS)
06072         {
06073             DWORD dwSize = sizeof(DWORD), dwMapping, dwType;
06074             lRc = RegQueryValueExW( hKey, L"Keyboard Mapping", NULL, &dwType, (PBYTE)&dwMapping, &dwSize );
06075             if (lRc == ERROR_SUCCESS)
06076             {
06077                 if ( ( dwVer <= MAKEIMEVERSION( 5, 0 ) && 
06078                        ( (BYTE)dwMapping == 0x22 || (BYTE)dwMapping == 0x23 ) )
06079                      ||
06080                      ( ( dwVer == MAKEIMEVERSION( 5, 1 ) || dwVer == MAKEIMEVERSION( 5, 2 ) ) &&
06081                        (BYTE)dwMapping >= 0x22 && (BYTE)dwMapping <= 0x24 )
06082                    )
06083                 {
06084                     s_bHorizontalReading = true;
06085                 }
06086             }
06087             RegCloseKey( hKey );
06088         }
06089     }
06090 }
06091 
06092 
06093 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06094 // Obtain the reading string upon WM_IME_NOTIFY/INM_PRIVATE notification.
06095 void CDXUTIMEEditBox::GetPrivateReadingString()
06096 {
06097     DWORD dwId = GetImeId();
06098     if( !dwId )
06099     {
06100         s_bShowReadingWindow = false;
06101         return;
06102     }
06103 
06104     HIMC hImc;
06105     hImc = _ImmGetContext( DXUTGetHWND() );
06106     if( !hImc )
06107     {
06108         s_bShowReadingWindow = false;
06109         return;
06110     }
06111 
06112     DWORD dwReadingStrLen = 0;
06113     DWORD dwErr = 0;
06114     WCHAR *pwszReadingStringBuffer = NULL;  // Buffer for when the IME supports GetReadingString()
06115     WCHAR *wstr = 0;
06116     bool bUnicodeIme = false;  // Whether the IME context component is Unicode.
06117     INPUTCONTEXT *lpIC = NULL;
06118 
06119     if( _GetReadingString )
06120     {
06121         UINT uMaxUiLen;
06122         BOOL bVertical;
06123         // Obtain the reading string size
06124         dwReadingStrLen = _GetReadingString( hImc, 0, NULL, (PINT)&dwErr, &bVertical, &uMaxUiLen );
06125         if( dwReadingStrLen )
06126         {
06127             wstr = pwszReadingStringBuffer = (LPWSTR)HeapAlloc( GetProcessHeap(), 0, sizeof(WCHAR) * dwReadingStrLen );
06128             if( !pwszReadingStringBuffer )
06129             {
06130                 // Out of memory. Exit.
06131                 _ImmReleaseContext( DXUTGetHWND(), hImc );
06132                 return;
06133             }
06134 
06135             // Obtain the reading string
06136             dwReadingStrLen = _GetReadingString( hImc, dwReadingStrLen, wstr, (PINT)&dwErr, &bVertical, &uMaxUiLen );
06137         }
06138 
06139         s_bHorizontalReading = !bVertical;
06140         bUnicodeIme = true;
06141     }
06142     else
06143     {
06144         // IMEs that doesn't implement Reading String API
06145 
06146         lpIC = _ImmLockIMC( hImc );
06147         
06148         LPBYTE p = 0;
06149         switch( dwId )
06150         {
06151             case IMEID_CHT_VER42: // New(Phonetic/ChanJie)IME98  : 4.2.x.x // Win98
06152             case IMEID_CHT_VER43: // New(Phonetic/ChanJie)IME98a : 4.3.x.x // WinMe, Win2k
06153             case IMEID_CHT_VER44: // New ChanJie IME98b          : 4.4.x.x // WinXP
06154                 p = *(LPBYTE *)((LPBYTE)_ImmLockIMCC( lpIC->hPrivate ) + 24 );
06155                 if( !p ) break;
06156                 dwReadingStrLen = *(DWORD *)( p + 7 * 4 + 32 * 4 );
06157                 dwErr = *(DWORD *)( p + 8 * 4 + 32 * 4 );
06158                 wstr = (WCHAR *)( p + 56 );
06159                 bUnicodeIme = true;
06160                 break;
06161 
06162             case IMEID_CHT_VER50: // 5.0.x.x // WinME
06163                 p = *(LPBYTE *)( (LPBYTE)_ImmLockIMCC( lpIC->hPrivate ) + 3 * 4 );
06164                 if( !p ) break;
06165                 p = *(LPBYTE *)( (LPBYTE)p + 1*4 + 5*4 + 4*2 );
06166                 if( !p ) break;
06167                 dwReadingStrLen = *(DWORD *)(p + 1*4 + (16*2+2*4) + 5*4 + 16);
06168                 dwErr = *(DWORD *)(p + 1*4 + (16*2+2*4) + 5*4 + 16 + 1*4);
06169                 wstr = (WCHAR *)(p + 1*4 + (16*2+2*4) + 5*4);
06170                 bUnicodeIme = false;
06171                 break;
06172 
06173             case IMEID_CHT_VER51: // 5.1.x.x // IME2002(w/OfficeXP)
06174             case IMEID_CHT_VER52: // 5.2.x.x // (w/whistler)
06175             case IMEID_CHS_VER53: // 5.3.x.x // SCIME2k or MSPY3 (w/OfficeXP and Whistler)
06176                 p = *(LPBYTE *)((LPBYTE)_ImmLockIMCC( lpIC->hPrivate ) + 4);
06177                 if( !p ) break;
06178                 p = *(LPBYTE *)((LPBYTE)p + 1*4 + 5*4);
06179                 if( !p ) break;
06180                 dwReadingStrLen = *(DWORD *)(p + 1*4 + (16*2+2*4) + 5*4 + 16 * 2);
06181                 dwErr = *(DWORD *)(p + 1*4 + (16*2+2*4) + 5*4 + 16 * 2 + 1*4);
06182                 wstr  = (WCHAR *) (p + 1*4 + (16*2+2*4) + 5*4);
06183                 bUnicodeIme = true;
06184                 break;
06185 
06186             // the code tested only with Win 98 SE (MSPY 1.5/ ver 4.1.0.21)
06187             case IMEID_CHS_VER41:
06188             {
06189                 int nOffset;
06190                 nOffset = ( GetImeId( 1 ) >= 0x00000002 ) ? 8 : 7;
06191 
06192                 p = *(LPBYTE *)((LPBYTE)_ImmLockIMCC( lpIC->hPrivate ) + nOffset * 4);
06193                 if( !p ) break;
06194                 dwReadingStrLen = *(DWORD *)(p + 7*4 + 16*2*4);
06195                 dwErr = *(DWORD *)(p + 8*4 + 16*2*4);
06196                 dwErr = __min( dwErr, dwReadingStrLen );
06197                 wstr = (WCHAR *)(p + 6*4 + 16*2*1);
06198                 bUnicodeIme = true;
06199                 break;
06200             }
06201 
06202             case IMEID_CHS_VER42: // 4.2.x.x // SCIME98 or MSPY2 (w/Office2k, Win2k, WinME, etc)
06203             {
06204                 OSVERSIONINFOW osi;
06205                 osi.dwOSVersionInfoSize = sizeof(OSVERSIONINFOW);
06206                 GetVersionExW( &osi );
06207 
06208                 int nTcharSize = ( osi.dwPlatformId == VER_PLATFORM_WIN32_NT ) ? sizeof(WCHAR) : sizeof(char);
06209                 p = *(LPBYTE *)((LPBYTE)_ImmLockIMCC( lpIC->hPrivate ) + 1*4 + 1*4 + 6*4);
06210                 if( !p ) break;
06211                 dwReadingStrLen = *(DWORD *)(p + 1*4 + (16*2+2*4) + 5*4 + 16 * nTcharSize);
06212                 dwErr = *(DWORD *)(p + 1*4 + (16*2+2*4) + 5*4 + 16 * nTcharSize + 1*4);
06213                 wstr  = (WCHAR *) (p + 1*4 + (16*2+2*4) + 5*4);
06214                 bUnicodeIme = ( osi.dwPlatformId == VER_PLATFORM_WIN32_NT ) ? true : false;
06215             }
06216         }   // switch
06217     }
06218 
06219     // Copy the reading string to the candidate list first
06220     s_CandList.awszCandidate[0][0] = 0;
06221     s_CandList.awszCandidate[1][0] = 0;
06222     s_CandList.awszCandidate[2][0] = 0;
06223     s_CandList.awszCandidate[3][0] = 0;
06224     s_CandList.dwCount = dwReadingStrLen;
06225     s_CandList.dwSelection = (DWORD)-1; // do not select any char
06226     if( bUnicodeIme )
06227     {
06228         UINT i;
06229         for( i = 0; i < dwReadingStrLen; ++i ) // dwlen > 0, if known IME
06230         {
06231             if( dwErr <= i && s_CandList.dwSelection == (DWORD)-1 )
06232             {
06233                 // select error char
06234                 s_CandList.dwSelection = i;
06235             }
06236 
06237             s_CandList.awszCandidate[i][0] = wstr[i];
06238             s_CandList.awszCandidate[i][1] = 0;
06239         }
06240         s_CandList.awszCandidate[i][0] = 0;
06241     }
06242     else
06243     {
06244         char *p = (char *)wstr;
06245         DWORD i, j;
06246         for( i = 0, j = 0; i < dwReadingStrLen; ++i, ++j ) // dwlen > 0, if known IME
06247         {
06248             if( dwErr <= i && s_CandList.dwSelection == (DWORD)-1 )
06249             {
06250                 s_CandList.dwSelection = j;
06251             }
06252             // Obtain the current code page
06253             WCHAR wszCodePage[8];
06254             UINT uCodePage = CP_ACP;  // Default code page
06255             if( GetLocaleInfoW( MAKELCID( GetLanguage(), SORT_DEFAULT ),
06256                                 LOCALE_IDEFAULTANSICODEPAGE,
06257                                 wszCodePage,
06258                                 sizeof(wszCodePage)/sizeof(wszCodePage[0]) ) )
06259             {
06260                 uCodePage = wcstoul( wszCodePage, NULL, 0 );
06261             }
06262             MultiByteToWideChar( uCodePage, 0, p + i, IsDBCSLeadByteEx( uCodePage, p[i] ) ? 2 : 1,
06263                                  s_CandList.awszCandidate[j], 1 );
06264             if( IsDBCSLeadByteEx( uCodePage, p[i] ) )
06265                 ++i;
06266         }
06267         s_CandList.awszCandidate[j][0] = 0;
06268         s_CandList.dwCount = j;
06269     }
06270     if( !_GetReadingString )
06271     {
06272         _ImmUnlockIMCC( lpIC->hPrivate );
06273         _ImmUnlockIMC( hImc );
06274         GetReadingWindowOrientation( dwId );
06275     }
06276     _ImmReleaseContext( DXUTGetHWND(), hImc );
06277 
06278     if( pwszReadingStringBuffer )
06279         HeapFree( GetProcessHeap(), 0, pwszReadingStringBuffer );
06280 
06281     // Copy the string to the reading string buffer
06282     if( s_CandList.dwCount > 0 )
06283         s_bShowReadingWindow = true;
06284     else
06285         s_bShowReadingWindow = false;
06286     if( s_bHorizontalReading )
06287     {
06288         s_CandList.nReadingError = -1;
06289         s_wszReadingString[0] = 0;
06290         for( UINT i = 0; i < s_CandList.dwCount; ++i )
06291         {
06292             if( s_CandList.dwSelection == i )
06293                 s_CandList.nReadingError = lstrlen( s_wszReadingString );
06294             StringCchCat( s_wszReadingString, 32, s_CandList.awszCandidate[i] );
06295         }
06296     }
06297 
06298     s_CandList.dwPageSize = MAX_CANDLIST;
06299 }
06300 
06301 
06302 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06303 // This function is used only briefly in CHT IME handling,
06304 // so accelerator isn't processed.
06305 void CDXUTIMEEditBox::PumpMessage()
06306 {
06307     MSG msg;
06308 
06309     while( PeekMessageW( &msg, NULL, 0, 0, PM_NOREMOVE ) )
06310     {
06311         if( !GetMessageW( &msg, NULL, 0, 0 ) )
06312         {
06313             PostQuitMessage( (int)msg.wParam );
06314             return;
06315         }
06316         TranslateMessage( &msg );
06317         DispatchMessageA( &msg );
06318     }
06319 }
06320 
06321 
06322 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06323 void CDXUTIMEEditBox::OnFocusIn()
06324 {
06325     CDXUTEditBox::OnFocusIn();
06326 
06327     if( s_bEnableImeSystem )
06328     {
06329         _ImmAssociateContext( DXUTGetHWND(), s_hImcDef );
06330         CheckToggleState();
06331     } else
06332         _ImmAssociateContext( DXUTGetHWND(), NULL );
06333 
06334     //
06335     // Set up the IME global state according to the current instance state
06336     //
06337     HIMC hImc;
06338     if( NULL != ( hImc = _ImmGetContext( DXUTGetHWND() ) ) ) 
06339     {
06340         if( !s_bEnableImeSystem )
06341             s_ImeState = IMEUI_STATE_OFF;
06342 
06343         _ImmReleaseContext( DXUTGetHWND(), hImc );
06344         CheckToggleState();
06345     }
06346 }
06347 
06348 
06349 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06350 void CDXUTIMEEditBox::OnFocusOut()
06351 {
06352     CDXUTEditBox::OnFocusOut();
06353 
06354     FinalizeString( false );  // Don't send the comp string as to match RichEdit behavior
06355 
06356     _ImmAssociateContext( DXUTGetHWND(), NULL );
06357 }
06358 
06359 
06360 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06361 bool CDXUTIMEEditBox::StaticMsgProc( UINT uMsg, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam )
06362 {
06363     HIMC hImc;
06364 
06365     if( !s_bEnableImeSystem )
06366         return false;
06367 
06368 #if defined(DEBUG) | defined(_DEBUG)
06369     m_bIMEStaticMsgProcCalled = true;
06370 #endif
06371 
06372     switch( uMsg )
06373     {
06374         case WM_ACTIVATEAPP:
06375             if( wParam )
06376             {
06377                 // Populate s_Locale with the list of keyboard layouts.
06378                 UINT cKL = GetKeyboardLayoutList( 0, NULL );
06379                 s_Locale.RemoveAll();
06380                 HKL *phKL = new HKL[cKL];
06381                 if( phKL )
06382                 {
06383                     GetKeyboardLayoutList( cKL, phKL );
06384                     for( UINT i = 0; i < cKL; ++i )
06385                     {
06386                         CInputLocale Locale;
06387 
06388                         // Filter out East Asian languages that are not IME.
06389                         if( ( PRIMARYLANGID( LOWORD( phKL[i] ) ) == LANG_CHINESE ||
06390                               PRIMARYLANGID( LOWORD( phKL[i] ) ) == LANG_JAPANESE ||
06391                               PRIMARYLANGID( LOWORD( phKL[i] ) ) == LANG_KOREAN ) &&
06392                               !_ImmIsIME( phKL[i] ) )
06393                               continue;
06394 
06395                         // If this language is already in the list, don't add it again.
06396                         bool bBreak = false;
06397                         for( int e = 0; e < s_Locale.GetSize(); ++e )
06398                             if( LOWORD( s_Locale.GetAt( e ).m_hKL ) ==
06399                                 LOWORD( phKL[i] ) )
06400                             {
06401                                 bBreak = true;
06402                                 break;
06403                             }
06404                         if( bBreak )
06405                             break;
06406 
06407                         Locale.m_hKL = phKL[i];
06408                         WCHAR wszDesc[128] = L"";
06409                         switch( PRIMARYLANGID( LOWORD( phKL[i] ) ) )
06410                         {
06411                             // Simplified Chinese
06412                             case LANG_CHINESE:
06413                                 switch( SUBLANGID( LOWORD( phKL[i] ) ) )
06414                                 {
06415                                     case SUBLANG_CHINESE_SIMPLIFIED:
06416                                         StringCchCopy( Locale.m_wszLangAbb, 3, s_aszIndicator[INDICATOR_CHS] );
06417                                         break;
06418                                     case SUBLANG_CHINESE_TRADITIONAL:
06419                                         StringCchCopy( Locale.m_wszLangAbb, 3, s_aszIndicator[INDICATOR_CHT] );
06420                                         break;
06421                                     default:    // unsupported sub-language
06422                                         GetLocaleInfoW( MAKELCID( LOWORD( phKL[i] ), SORT_DEFAULT ), LOCALE_SABBREVLANGNAME, wszDesc, 128 );
06423                                         Locale.m_wszLangAbb[0] = wszDesc[0];
06424                                         Locale.m_wszLangAbb[1] = towlower( wszDesc[1] );
06425                                         Locale.m_wszLangAbb[2] = L'\0';
06426                                         break;
06427                                 }
06428                                 break;
06429                             // Korean
06430                             case LANG_KOREAN:
06431                                 StringCchCopy( Locale.m_wszLangAbb, 3, s_aszIndicator[INDICATOR_KOREAN] );
06432                                 break;
06433                             // Japanese
06434                             case LANG_JAPANESE:
06435                                 StringCchCopy( Locale.m_wszLangAbb, 3, s_aszIndicator[INDICATOR_JAPANESE] );
06436                                 break;         
06437                             default:
06438                                 // A non-IME language.  Obtain the language abbreviation
06439                                 // and store it for rendering the indicator later.
06440                                 GetLocaleInfoW( MAKELCID( LOWORD( phKL[i] ), SORT_DEFAULT ), LOCALE_SABBREVLANGNAME, wszDesc, 128 );
06441                                 Locale.m_wszLangAbb[0] = wszDesc[0];
06442                                 Locale.m_wszLangAbb[1] = towlower( wszDesc[1] );
06443                                 Locale.m_wszLangAbb[2] = L'\0';
06444                                 break;
06445                         }
06446 
06447                         GetLocaleInfoW( MAKELCID( LOWORD( phKL[i] ), SORT_DEFAULT ), LOCALE_SLANGUAGE, wszDesc, 128 );
06448                         StringCchCopy( Locale.m_wszLang, 64, wszDesc );
06449 
06450                         s_Locale.Add( Locale );
06451                     }
06452                     delete[] phKL;
06453                 }
06454             }
06455             break;
06456 
06457         case WM_INPUTLANGCHANGE:
06458             DXUTTRACE( L"WM_INPUTLANGCHANGE\n" );
06459             {
06460                 UINT uLang = GetPrimaryLanguage();
06461                 CheckToggleState();
06462                 if ( uLang != GetPrimaryLanguage() )
06463                 {
06464                     // Korean IME always inserts on keystroke.  Other IMEs do not.
06465                     s_bInsertOnType = ( GetPrimaryLanguage() == LANG_KOREAN );
06466                 }
06467 
06468                 // IME changed.  Setup the new IME.
06469                 SetupImeApi();
06470                 if( _ShowReadingWindow )
06471                 {
06472                     if ( NULL != ( hImc = _ImmGetContext( DXUTGetHWND() ) ) )
06473                     {
06474                         _ShowReadingWindow( hImc, false );
06475                         _ImmReleaseContext( DXUTGetHWND(), hImc );
06476                     }
06477                 }
06478             }
06479             return true;
06480 
06481         case WM_IME_SETCONTEXT:
06482             DXUTTRACE( L"WM_IME_SETCONTEXT\n" );
06483             //
06484             // We don't want anything to display, so we have to clear this
06485             //
06486             lParam = 0;
06487             return false;
06488 
06489         // Handle WM_IME_STARTCOMPOSITION here since
06490         // we do not want the default IME handler to see
06491         // this when our fullscreen app is running.
06492         case WM_IME_STARTCOMPOSITION:
06493             DXUTTRACE( L"WM_IME_STARTCOMPOSITION\n" );
06494             ResetCompositionString();
06495             // Since the composition string has its own caret, we don't render
06496             // the edit control's own caret to avoid double carets on screen.
06497             s_bHideCaret = true;
06498             return true;
06499 
06500         case WM_IME_COMPOSITION:
06501             DXUTTRACE( L"WM_IME_COMPOSITION\n" );
06502             return false;
06503     }
06504 
06505     return false;
06506 }
06507 
06508 
06509 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06510 bool CDXUTIMEEditBox::HandleMouse( UINT uMsg, POINT pt, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam )
06511 {
06512     if( !m_bEnabled || !m_bVisible )
06513         return false;
06514 
06515     switch( uMsg )
06516     {
06517         case WM_LBUTTONDOWN:
06518         case WM_LBUTTONDBLCLK:
06519         {
06520             DXUTFontNode* pFont = m_pDialog->GetFont( m_Elements.GetAt( 9 )->iFont );
06521 
06522             // Check if this click is on top of the composition string
06523             int nCompStrWidth;
06524             s_CompString.CPtoX( s_CompString.GetTextSize(), FALSE, &nCompStrWidth );
06525 
06526             if( s_ptCompString.x <= pt.x &&
06527                 s_ptCompString.y <= pt.y &&
06528                 s_ptCompString.x + nCompStrWidth > pt.x &&
06529                 s_ptCompString.y + pFont->nHeight > pt.y )
06530             {
06531                 int nCharBodyHit, nCharHit;
06532                 int nTrail;
06533 
06534                 // Determine the character clicked on.
06535                 s_CompString.XtoCP( pt.x - s_ptCompString.x, &nCharBodyHit, &nTrail );
06536                 if( nTrail && nCharBodyHit < s_CompString.GetTextSize() )
06537                     nCharHit = nCharBodyHit + 1;
06538                 else
06539                     nCharHit = nCharBodyHit;
06540 
06541                 // Now generate keypress events to move the comp string cursor
06542                 // to the click point.  First, if the candidate window is displayed,
06543                 // send Esc to close it.
06544                 HIMC hImc = _ImmGetContext( DXUTGetHWND() );
06545                 if( !hImc )
06546                     return true;
06547 
06548                 _ImmNotifyIME( hImc, NI_CLOSECANDIDATE, 0, 0 );
06549                 _ImmReleaseContext( DXUTGetHWND(), hImc );
06550 
06551                 switch( GetPrimaryLanguage() )
06552                 {
06553                     case LANG_JAPANESE:
06554                         // For Japanese, there are two cases.  If s_nFirstTargetConv is
06555                         // -1, the comp string hasn't been converted yet, and we use
06556                         // s_nCompCaret.  For any other value of s_nFirstTargetConv,
06557                         // the string has been converted, so we use clause information.
06558 
06559                         if( s_nFirstTargetConv != -1 )
06560                         {
06561                             int nClauseClicked = 0;
06562                             while( (int)s_adwCompStringClause[nClauseClicked + 1] <= nCharBodyHit )
06563                                 ++nClauseClicked;
06564 
06565                             int nClauseSelected = 0;
06566                             while( (int)s_adwCompStringClause[nClauseSelected + 1] <= s_nFirstTargetConv )
06567                                 ++nClauseSelected;
06568 
06569                             BYTE nVirtKey = nClauseClicked > nClauseSelected ? VK_RIGHT : VK_LEFT;
06570                             int nSendCount = abs( nClauseClicked - nClauseSelected );
06571                             while( nSendCount-- > 0 )
06572                                 SendKey( nVirtKey );
06573 
06574                             return true;
06575                         }
06576 
06577                         // Not converted case. Fall thru to Chinese case.
06578 
06579                     case LANG_CHINESE:
06580                     {
06581                         // For Chinese, use s_nCompCaret.
06582                         BYTE nVirtKey = nCharHit > s_nCompCaret ? VK_RIGHT : VK_LEFT;
06583                         int nSendCount = abs( nCharHit - s_nCompCaret );
06584                         while( nSendCount-- > 0 )
06585                             SendKey( nVirtKey );
06586                         break;
06587                     }
06588                 }
06589 
06590                 return true;
06591             }
06592 
06593             // Check if the click is on top of the candidate window
06594             if( s_CandList.bShowWindow && PtInRect( &s_CandList.rcCandidate, pt ) )
06595             {
06596                 if( s_bVerticalCand )
06597                 {
06598                     // Vertical candidate window
06599 
06600                     // Compute the row the click is on
06601                     int nRow = ( pt.y - s_CandList.rcCandidate.top ) / pFont->nHeight;
06602 
06603                     if( nRow < (int)s_CandList.dwCount )
06604                     {
06605                         // nRow is a valid entry.
06606                         // Now emulate keystrokes to select the candidate at this row.
06607                         switch( GetPrimaryLanguage() )
06608                         {
06609                             case LANG_CHINESE:
06610                             case LANG_KOREAN:
06611                                 // For Chinese and Korean, simply send the number keystroke.
06612                                 SendKey( (BYTE) ('0' + nRow + 1) );
06613                                 break;
06614 
06615                             case LANG_JAPANESE:
06616                                 // For Japanese, move the selection to the target row,
06617                                 // then send Right, then send Left.
06618 
06619                                 BYTE nVirtKey;
06620                                 if( nRow > (int)s_CandList.dwSelection )
06621                                     nVirtKey = VK_DOWN;
06622                                 else
06623                                     nVirtKey = VK_UP;
06624                                 int nNumToHit = abs( int( nRow - s_CandList.dwSelection ) );
06625                                 for( int nStrike = 0; nStrike < nNumToHit; ++nStrike )
06626                                     SendKey( nVirtKey );
06627 
06628                                 // Do this to close the candidate window without ending composition.
06629                                 SendKey( VK_RIGHT );
06630                                 SendKey( VK_LEFT );
06631 
06632                                 break;
06633                         }
06634                     }
06635                 } else
06636                 {
06637                     // Horizontal candidate window
06638 
06639                     // Determine which the character the click has hit.
06640                     int nCharHit;
06641                     int nTrail;
06642                     s_CandList.HoriCand.XtoCP( pt.x - s_CandList.rcCandidate.left, &nCharHit, &nTrail );
06643 
06644                     // Determine which candidate string the character belongs to.
06645                     int nCandidate = s_CandList.dwCount - 1;
06646 
06647                     int nEntryStart = 0;
06648                     for( UINT i = 0; i < s_CandList.dwCount; ++i )
06649                     {
06650                         if( nCharHit >= nEntryStart )
06651                         {
06652                             // Haven't found it.
06653                             nEntryStart += lstrlenW( s_CandList.awszCandidate[i] ) + 1;  // plus space separator
06654                         } else
06655                         {
06656                             // Found it.  This entry starts at the right side of the click point,
06657                             // so the char belongs to the previous entry.
06658                             nCandidate = i - 1;
06659                             break;
06660                         }
06661                     }
06662 
06663                     // Now emulate keystrokes to select the candidate entry.
06664                     switch( GetPrimaryLanguage() )
06665                     {
06666                         case LANG_CHINESE:
06667                         case LANG_KOREAN:
06668                             // For Chinese and Korean, simply send the number keystroke.
06669                             SendKey( (BYTE) ('0' + nCandidate + 1) );
06670                             break;
06671                     }
06672                 }
06673 
06674                 return true;
06675             }
06676         }
06677     }
06678 
06679     // If we didn't care for the msg, let the parent process it.
06680     return CDXUTEditBox::HandleMouse( uMsg, pt, wParam, lParam );
06681 }
06682 
06683 
06684 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06685 bool CDXUTIMEEditBox::MsgProc( UINT uMsg, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam )
06686 {
06687     if( !m_bEnabled || !m_bVisible )
06688         return false;
06689 
06690 #if defined(DEBUG) | defined(_DEBUG)
06691     // DXUT.cpp used to call CDXUTIMEEditBox::StaticMsgProc() so that, but now
06692     // this is the application's responsiblity.  To do this, call 
06693     // CDXUTDialogResourceManager::MsgProc() before calling this function.
06694     assert( m_bIMEStaticMsgProcCalled && L"To fix, call CDXUTDialogResourceManager::MsgProc() first" );
06695 #endif
06696 
06697     bool trappedData;
06698     bool *trapped = &trappedData;
06699 
06700     HIMC hImc;
06701     static LPARAM lAlt = 0x80000000, lCtrl = 0x80000000, lShift = 0x80000000;
06702 
06703     *trapped = false;
06704     if( !s_bEnableImeSystem )
06705         return CDXUTEditBox::MsgProc( uMsg, wParam, lParam );
06706 
06707     switch( uMsg )
06708     {
06709         //
06710         //  IME Handling
06711         //
06712         case WM_IME_COMPOSITION:
06713             DXUTTRACE( L"WM_IME_COMPOSITION\n" );
06714             {
06715                 LONG lRet;  // Returned count in CHARACTERS
06716                 WCHAR wszCompStr[MAX_COMPSTRING_SIZE];
06717 
06718                 *trapped = true;
06719                 if( NULL == ( hImc = _ImmGetContext( DXUTGetHWND() ) ) )
06720                 {
06721                     break;
06722                 }
06723 
06724                 // Get the caret position in composition string
06725                 if ( lParam & GCS_CURSORPOS )
06726                 {
06727                     s_nCompCaret = _ImmGetCompositionStringW( hImc, GCS_CURSORPOS, NULL, 0 );
06728                     if( s_nCompCaret < 0 )
06729                         s_nCompCaret = 0; // On error, set caret to pos 0.
06730                 }
06731 
06732                 // ResultStr must be processed before composition string.
06733                 //
06734                 // This is because for some IMEs, such as CHT, pressing Enter
06735                 // to complete the composition sends WM_IME_COMPOSITION with both
06736                 // GCS_RESULTSTR and GCS_COMPSTR.  Retrieving the result string
06737                 // gives the correct string, while retrieving the comp string
06738                 // (GCS_COMPSTR) gives empty string.  GCS_RESULTSTR should be
06739                 // handled first so that the application receives the string.  Then
06740                 // GCS_COMPSTR can be handled to clear the comp string buffer.
06741 
06742                 if ( lParam & GCS_RESULTSTR )
06743                 {
06744                     DXUTTRACE( L"  GCS_RESULTSTR\n" );
06745                     lRet = _ImmGetCompositionStringW( hImc, GCS_RESULTSTR, wszCompStr, sizeof( wszCompStr ) );
06746                     if( lRet > 0 )
06747                     {
06748                         lRet /= sizeof(WCHAR);
06749                         wszCompStr[lRet] = 0;  // Force terminate
06750                         TruncateCompString( false, (int)wcslen( wszCompStr ) );
06751                         s_CompString.SetText( wszCompStr );
06752                         SendCompString();
06753                         ResetCompositionString();
06754                     }
06755                 }
06756 
06757                 //
06758                 // Reads in the composition string.
06759                 //
06760                 if ( lParam & GCS_COMPSTR )
06761                 {
06762                     DXUTTRACE( L"  GCS_COMPSTR\n" );
06764                     // Retrieve the latest user-selected IME candidates
06765                     lRet = _ImmGetCompositionStringW( hImc, GCS_COMPSTR, wszCompStr, sizeof( wszCompStr ) );
06766                     if( lRet > 0 )
06767                     {
06768                         lRet /= sizeof(WCHAR);  // Convert size in byte to size in char
06769                         wszCompStr[lRet] = 0;  // Force terminate
06770                         //
06771                         // Remove the whole of the string
06772                         //
06773                         TruncateCompString( false, (int)wcslen( wszCompStr ) );
06774 
06775                         s_CompString.SetText( wszCompStr );
06776 
06777                         // Older CHT IME uses composition string for reading string
06778                         if ( GetLanguage() == LANG_CHT && !GetImeId() )
06779                         {
06780                             if( lstrlen( s_CompString.GetBuffer() ) )
06781                             {
06782                                 s_CandList.dwCount = 4;             // Maximum possible length for reading string is 4
06783                                 s_CandList.dwSelection = (DWORD)-1; // don't select any candidate
06784 
06785                                 // Copy the reading string to the candidate list
06786                                 for( int i = 3; i >= 0; --i )
06787                                 {
06788                                     if( i > lstrlen( s_CompString.GetBuffer() ) - 1 )
06789                                         s_CandList.awszCandidate[i][0] = 0;  // Doesn't exist
06790                                     else
06791                                     {
06792                                         s_CandList.awszCandidate[i][0] = s_CompString[i];
06793                                         s_CandList.awszCandidate[i][1] = 0;
06794                                     }
06795                                 }
06796                                 s_CandList.dwPageSize = MAX_CANDLIST;
06797                                 // Clear comp string after we are done copying
06798                                 ZeroMemory( (LPVOID)s_CompString.GetBuffer(), 4 * sizeof(WCHAR) );
06799                                 s_bShowReadingWindow = true;
06800                                 GetReadingWindowOrientation( 0 );
06801                                 if( s_bHorizontalReading )
06802                                 {
06803                                     s_CandList.nReadingError = -1;  // Clear error
06804 
06805                                     // Create a string that consists of the current
06806                                     // reading string.  Since horizontal reading window
06807                                     // is used, we take advantage of this by rendering
06808                                     // one string instead of several.
06809                                     //
06810                                     // Copy the reading string from the candidate list
06811                                     // to the reading string buffer.
06812                                     s_wszReadingString[0] = 0;
06813                                     for( UINT i = 0; i < s_CandList.dwCount; ++i )
06814                                     {
06815                                         if( s_CandList.dwSelection == i )
06816                                             s_CandList.nReadingError = lstrlen( s_wszReadingString );
06817                                         StringCchCat( s_wszReadingString, 32, s_CandList.awszCandidate[i] );
06818                                     }
06819                                 }
06820                             }
06821                             else
06822                             {
06823                                 s_CandList.dwCount = 0;
06824                                 s_bShowReadingWindow = false;
06825                             }
06826                         }
06827 
06828                         if( s_bInsertOnType )
06829                         {
06830                             // Send composition string to the edit control
06831                             SendCompString();
06832                             // Restore the caret to the correct location.
06833                             // It's at the end right now, so compute the number
06834                             // of times left arrow should be pressed to
06835                             // send it to the original position.
06836                             int nCount = lstrlen( s_CompString.GetBuffer() + s_nCompCaret );
06837                             // Send left keystrokes
06838                             for( int i = 0; i < nCount; ++i )
06839                                 SendMessage( DXUTGetHWND(), WM_KEYDOWN, VK_LEFT, 0 );
06840                             SendMessage( DXUTGetHWND(), WM_KEYUP, VK_LEFT, 0 );
06841                         }
06842                     }
06843 
06844                     ResetCaretBlink();
06845                 }
06846 
06847                 // Retrieve comp string attributes
06848                 if( lParam & GCS_COMPATTR )
06849                 {
06850                     lRet = _ImmGetCompositionStringW( hImc, GCS_COMPATTR, s_abCompStringAttr, sizeof( s_abCompStringAttr ) );
06851                     if( lRet > 0 )
06852                         s_abCompStringAttr[lRet] = 0;  // ??? Is this needed for attributes?
06853                 }
06854 
06855                 // Retrieve clause information
06856                 if( lParam & GCS_COMPCLAUSE )
06857                 {
06858                     lRet = _ImmGetCompositionStringW(hImc, GCS_COMPCLAUSE, s_adwCompStringClause, sizeof( s_adwCompStringClause ) );
06859                     s_adwCompStringClause[lRet / sizeof(DWORD)] = 0;  // Terminate
06860                 }
06861 
06862                 _ImmReleaseContext( DXUTGetHWND(), hImc );
06863             }
06864             break;
06865 
06866         case WM_IME_ENDCOMPOSITION:
06867             DXUTTRACE( L"WM_IME_ENDCOMPOSITION\n" );
06868             TruncateCompString();
06869             ResetCompositionString();
06870             // We can show the edit control's caret again.
06871             s_bHideCaret = false;
06872             // Hide reading window
06873             s_bShowReadingWindow = false;
06874             break;
06875 
06876         case WM_IME_NOTIFY:
06877             DXUTTRACE( L"WM_IME_NOTIFY %u\n", wParam );
06878             switch( wParam )
06879             {
06880                 case IMN_SETCONVERSIONMODE:
06881                     DXUTTRACE( L"  IMN_SETCONVERSIONMODE\n" );
06882                 case IMN_SETOPENSTATUS:
06883                     DXUTTRACE( L"  IMN_SETOPENSTATUS\n" );
06884                     CheckToggleState();
06885                     break;
06886 
06887                 case IMN_OPENCANDIDATE:
06888                 case IMN_CHANGECANDIDATE:
06889                 {
06890                     DXUTTRACE( wParam == IMN_CHANGECANDIDATE ? L"  IMN_CHANGECANDIDATE\n" : L"  IMN_OPENCANDIDATE\n" );
06891 
06892                     s_CandList.bShowWindow = true;
06893                     *trapped = true;
06894                     if( NULL == ( hImc = _ImmGetContext( DXUTGetHWND() ) ) )
06895                         break;
06896 
06897                     LPCANDIDATELIST lpCandList = NULL;
06898                     DWORD dwLenRequired;
06899 
06900                     s_bShowReadingWindow = false;
06901                     // Retrieve the candidate list
06902                     dwLenRequired = _ImmGetCandidateListW( hImc, 0, NULL, 0 );
06903                     if( dwLenRequired )
06904                     {
06905                         lpCandList = (LPCANDIDATELIST)HeapAlloc( GetProcessHeap(), 0, dwLenRequired );
06906                         dwLenRequired = _ImmGetCandidateListW( hImc, 0, lpCandList, dwLenRequired );
06907                     }
06908 
06909                     if( lpCandList )
06910                     {
06911                         // Update candidate list data
06912                         s_CandList.dwSelection = lpCandList->dwSelection;
06913                         s_CandList.dwCount = lpCandList->dwCount;
06914 
06915                         int nPageTopIndex = 0;
06916                         s_CandList.dwPageSize = __min( lpCandList->dwPageSize, MAX_CANDLIST );
06917                         if( GetPrimaryLanguage() == LANG_JAPANESE )
06918                         {
06919                             // Japanese IME organizes its candidate list a little
06920                             // differently from the other IMEs.
06921                             nPageTopIndex = ( s_CandList.dwSelection / s_CandList.dwPageSize ) * s_CandList.dwPageSize;
06922                         }
06923                         else
06924                             nPageTopIndex = lpCandList->dwPageStart;
06925 
06926                         // Make selection index relative to first entry of page
06927                         s_CandList.dwSelection = ( GetLanguage() == LANG_CHS && !GetImeId() ) ? (DWORD)-1
06928                                                  : s_CandList.dwSelection - nPageTopIndex;
06929 
06930                         ZeroMemory( s_CandList.awszCandidate, sizeof(s_CandList.awszCandidate) );
06931                         for( UINT i = nPageTopIndex, j = 0;
06932                             (DWORD)i < lpCandList->dwCount && j < s_CandList.dwPageSize;
06933                             i++, j++ )
06934                         {
06935                             // Initialize the candidate list strings
06936                             LPWSTR pwsz = s_CandList.awszCandidate[j];
06937                             // For every candidate string entry,
06938                             // write [index] + Space + [String] if vertical,
06939                             // write [index] + [String] + Space if horizontal.
06940                             *pwsz++ = (WCHAR)( L'0' + ( (j + 1) % 10 ) );  // Index displayed is 1 based
06941                             if( s_bVerticalCand )
06942                                 *pwsz++ = L' ';
06943                             WCHAR *pwszNewCand = (LPWSTR)( (LPBYTE)lpCandList + lpCandList->dwOffset[i] );
06944                             while ( *pwszNewCand )
06945                                 *pwsz++ = *pwszNewCand++;
06946                             if( !s_bVerticalCand )
06947                                 *pwsz++ = L' ';
06948                             *pwsz = 0;  // Terminate
06949                         }
06950 
06951                         // Make dwCount in s_CandList be number of valid entries in the page.
06952                         s_CandList.dwCount = lpCandList->dwCount - lpCandList->dwPageStart;
06953                         if( s_CandList.dwCount > lpCandList->dwPageSize )
06954                             s_CandList.dwCount = lpCandList->dwPageSize;
06955 
06956                         HeapFree( GetProcessHeap(), 0, lpCandList );
06957                         _ImmReleaseContext( DXUTGetHWND(), hImc );
06958 
06959                         // Korean and old Chinese IME can't have selection.
06960                         // User must use the number hotkey or Enter to select
06961                         // a candidate.
06962                         if( GetPrimaryLanguage() == LANG_KOREAN ||
06963                             GetLanguage() == LANG_CHT && !GetImeId() )
06964                         {
06965                             s_CandList.dwSelection = (DWORD)-1;
06966                         }
06967 
06968                         // Initialize s_CandList.HoriCand if we have a
06969                         // horizontal candidate window.
06970                         if( !s_bVerticalCand )
06971                         {
06972                             WCHAR wszCand[256] = L"";
06973 
06974                             s_CandList.nFirstSelected = 0;
06975                             s_CandList.nHoriSelectedLen = 0;
06976                             for( UINT i = 0; i < MAX_CANDLIST; ++i )
06977                             {
06978                                 if( s_CandList.awszCandidate[i][0] == L'\0' )
06979                                     break;
06980 
06981                                 WCHAR wszEntry[32];
06982                                 StringCchPrintf( wszEntry, 32, L"%s ", s_CandList.awszCandidate[i] );
06983                                 // If this is the selected entry, mark its char position.
06984                                 if( s_CandList.dwSelection == i )
06985                                 {
06986                                     s_CandList.nFirstSelected = lstrlen( wszCand );
06987                                     s_CandList.nHoriSelectedLen = lstrlen( wszEntry ) - 1;  // Minus space
06988                                 }
06989                                 StringCchCat( wszCand, 256, wszEntry );
06990                             }
06991                             wszCand[lstrlen(wszCand) - 1] = L'\0';  // Remove the last space
06992                             s_CandList.HoriCand.SetText( wszCand );
06993                         }
06994                     }
06995                     break;
06996                 }
06997 
06998                 case IMN_CLOSECANDIDATE:
06999                 {
07000                     DXUTTRACE( L"  IMN_CLOSECANDIDATE\n" );
07001                     s_CandList.bShowWindow = false;
07002                     if( !s_bShowReadingWindow )
07003                     {
07004                         s_CandList.dwCount = 0;
07005                         ZeroMemory( s_CandList.awszCandidate, sizeof(s_CandList.awszCandidate) );
07006                     }
07007                     *trapped = true;
07008                     break;
07009                 }
07010 
07011                 case IMN_PRIVATE:
07012                     DXUTTRACE( L"  IMN_PRIVATE\n" );
07013                     {
07014                         if( !s_CandList.bShowWindow )
07015                             GetPrivateReadingString();
07016 
07017                         // Trap some messages to hide reading window
07018                         DWORD dwId = GetImeId();
07019                         switch( dwId )
07020                         {
07021                             case IMEID_CHT_VER42:
07022                             case IMEID_CHT_VER43:
07023                             case IMEID_CHT_VER44:
07024                             case IMEID_CHS_VER41:
07025                             case IMEID_CHS_VER42:
07026                                 if( ( lParam == 1 ) || ( lParam == 2 ) )
07027                                 {
07028                                     *trapped = true;
07029                                 }
07030                                 break;
07031 
07032                             case IMEID_CHT_VER50:
07033                             case IMEID_CHT_VER51:
07034                             case IMEID_CHT_VER52:
07035                             case IMEID_CHT_VER60:
07036                             case IMEID_CHS_VER53:
07037                                 if( (lParam == 16) || (lParam == 17) || (lParam == 26) || (lParam == 27) || (lParam == 28) )
07038                                 {
07039                                     *trapped = true;
07040                                 }
07041                                 break;
07042                         }
07043                     }
07044                     break;
07045 
07046                 default:
07047                     *trapped = true;
07048                     break;
07049             }
07050             break;
07051 
07052         // When Text Service Framework is installed in Win2K, Alt+Shift and Ctrl+Shift combination (to switch input
07053         // locale / keyboard layout) doesn't send WM_KEYUP message for the key that is released first. We need to check
07054         // if these keys are actually up whenever we receive key up message for other keys.
07055         case WM_KEYUP:
07056         case WM_SYSKEYUP:
07057             if ( !( lAlt & 0x80000000 ) && wParam != VK_MENU && ( GetAsyncKeyState( VK_MENU ) & 0x8000 ) == 0 )
07058             {
07059                 PostMessageW( GetFocus(), WM_KEYUP, (WPARAM)VK_MENU, ( lAlt & 0x01ff0000 ) | 0xC0000001 );
07060             }   
07061             else if ( !( lCtrl & 0x80000000 ) && wParam != VK_CONTROL && ( GetAsyncKeyState( VK_CONTROL ) & 0x8000 ) == 0 )
07062             {
07063                 PostMessageW( GetFocus(), WM_KEYUP, (WPARAM)VK_CONTROL, ( lCtrl & 0x01ff0000 ) | 0xC0000001 );
07064             }
07065             else if ( !( lShift & 0x80000000 ) && wParam != VK_SHIFT && ( GetAsyncKeyState( VK_SHIFT ) & 0x8000 ) == 0 )
07066             {
07067                 PostMessageW( GetFocus(), WM_KEYUP, (WPARAM)VK_SHIFT, ( lShift & 0x01ff0000 ) | 0xC0000001 );
07068             }
07069             // fall through WM_KEYDOWN / WM_SYSKEYDOWN
07070         case WM_KEYDOWN:
07071         case WM_SYSKEYDOWN:
07072             switch ( wParam )
07073             {
07074                 case VK_MENU:
07075                     lAlt = lParam;
07076                     break;
07077                 case VK_SHIFT:
07078                     lShift = lParam;
07079                     break;
07080                 case VK_CONTROL:
07081                     lCtrl = lParam;
07082                     break;
07083             }
07084             //break;
07085             // Fall through to default case
07086             // so we invoke the parent.
07087 
07088         default:
07089             // Let the parent handle the message that we
07090             // don't handle.
07091             return CDXUTEditBox::MsgProc( uMsg, wParam, lParam );
07092 
07093     }  // switch
07094 
07095     return *trapped;
07096 }
07097 
07098 
07099 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07100 void CDXUTIMEEditBox::RenderCandidateReadingWindow( IDirect3DDevice9* pd3dDevice, float fElapsedTime, bool bReading )
07101 {
07102     RECT rc;
07103     UINT nNumEntries = bReading ? 4 : MAX_CANDLIST;
07104     D3DCOLOR TextColor, TextBkColor, SelTextColor, SelBkColor;
07105     int nX, nXFirst, nXComp;
07106     m_Buffer.CPtoX( m_nCaret, FALSE, &nX );
07107     m_Buffer.CPtoX( m_nFirstVisible, FALSE, &nXFirst );
07108 
07109     if( bReading )
07110     {
07111         TextColor = m_ReadingColor;
07112         TextBkColor = m_ReadingWinColor;
07113         SelTextColor = m_ReadingSelColor;
07114         SelBkColor = m_ReadingSelBkColor;
07115     } else
07116     {
07117         TextColor = m_CandidateColor;
07118         TextBkColor = m_CandidateWinColor;
07119         SelTextColor = m_CandidateSelColor;
07120         SelBkColor = m_CandidateSelBkColor;
07121     }
07122 
07123     // For Japanese IME, align the window with the first target converted character.
07124     // For all other IMEs, align with the caret.  This is because the caret
07125     // does not move for Japanese IME.
07126     if ( GetLanguage() == LANG_CHT && !GetImeId() )
07127         nXComp = 0;
07128     else
07129     if( GetPrimaryLanguage() == LANG_JAPANESE )
07130         s_CompString.CPtoX( s_nFirstTargetConv, FALSE, &nXComp );
07131     else
07132         s_CompString.CPtoX( s_nCompCaret, FALSE, &nXComp );
07133 
07134     // Compute the size of the candidate window
07135     int nWidthRequired = 0;
07136     int nHeightRequired = 0;
07137     int nSingleLineHeight = 0;
07138 
07139     if( ( s_bVerticalCand && !bReading ) ||
07140         ( !s_bHorizontalReading && bReading ) )
07141     {
07142         // Vertical window
07143         for( UINT i = 0; i < nNumEntries; ++i )
07144         {
07145             if( s_CandList.awszCandidate[i][0] == L'\0' )
07146                 break;
07147             SetRect( &rc, 0, 0, 0, 0 );
07148             m_pDialog->CalcTextRect( s_CandList.awszCandidate[i], m_Elements.GetAt( 1 ), &rc );
07149             nWidthRequired = __max( nWidthRequired, rc.right - rc.left );
07150             nSingleLineHeight = __max( nSingleLineHeight, rc.bottom - rc.top );
07151         }
07152         nHeightRequired = nSingleLineHeight * nNumEntries;
07153     } else
07154     {
07155         // Horizontal window
07156         SetRect( &rc, 0, 0, 0, 0 );
07157         if( bReading )
07158             m_pDialog->CalcTextRect( s_wszReadingString, m_Elements.GetAt( 1 ), &rc );
07159         else
07160             m_pDialog->CalcTextRect( s_CandList.HoriCand.GetBuffer(), m_Elements.GetAt( 1 ), &rc );
07161         nWidthRequired = rc.right - rc.left;
07162         nSingleLineHeight = nHeightRequired = rc.bottom - rc.top;
07163     }
07164 
07165     // Now that we have the dimension, calculate the location for the candidate window.
07166     // We attempt to fit the window in this order:
07167     // bottom, top, right, left.
07168 
07169     bool bHasPosition = false;
07170 
07171     // Bottom
07172     SetRect( &rc, s_ptCompString.x + nXComp, s_ptCompString.y + m_rcText.bottom - m_rcText.top,
07173                   s_ptCompString.x + nXComp + nWidthRequired, s_ptCompString.y + m_rcText.bottom - m_rcText.top + nHeightRequired );
07174     // if the right edge is cut off, move it left.
07175     if( rc.right > m_pDialog->GetWidth() )
07176     {
07177         rc.left -= rc.right - m_pDialog->GetWidth();
07178         rc.right = m_pDialog->GetWidth();
07179     }
07180     if( rc.bottom <= m_pDialog->GetHeight() )
07181         bHasPosition = true;
07182 
07183     // Top
07184     if( !bHasPosition )
07185     {
07186         SetRect( &rc, s_ptCompString.x + nXComp, s_ptCompString.y - nHeightRequired,
07187                       s_ptCompString.x + nXComp + nWidthRequired, s_ptCompString.y );
07188         // if the right edge is cut off, move it left.
07189         if( rc.right > m_pDialog->GetWidth() )
07190         {
07191             rc.left -= rc.right - m_pDialog->GetWidth();
07192             rc.right = m_pDialog->GetWidth();
07193         }
07194         if( rc.top >= 0 )
07195             bHasPosition = true;
07196     }
07197 
07198     // Right
07199     if( !bHasPosition )
07200     {
07201         int nXCompTrail;
07202         s_CompString.CPtoX( s_nCompCaret, TRUE, &nXCompTrail );
07203         SetRect( &rc, s_ptCompString.x + nXCompTrail, 0,
07204                       s_ptCompString.x + nXCompTrail + nWidthRequired, nHeightRequired );
07205         if( rc.right <= m_pDialog->GetWidth() )
07206             bHasPosition = true;
07207     }
07208 
07209     // Left
07210     if( !bHasPosition )
07211     {
07212         SetRect( &rc, s_ptCompString.x + nXComp - nWidthRequired, 0,
07213                       s_ptCompString.x + nXComp, nHeightRequired );
07214         if( rc.right >= 0 )
07215             bHasPosition = true;
07216     }
07217 
07218     if( !bHasPosition )
07219     {
07220         // The dialog is too small for the candidate window.
07221         // Fall back to render at 0, 0.  Some part of the window
07222         // will be cut off.
07223         rc.left = 0;
07224         rc.right = nWidthRequired;
07225     }
07226 
07227     // If we are rendering the candidate window, save the position
07228     // so that mouse clicks are checked properly.
07229     if( !bReading )
07230         s_CandList.rcCandidate = rc;
07231 
07232     // Render the elements
07233     m_pDialog->DrawRect( &rc, TextBkColor );
07234     if( ( s_bVerticalCand && !bReading ) ||
07235         ( !s_bHorizontalReading && bReading ) )
07236     {
07237         // Vertical candidate window
07238         for( UINT i = 0; i < nNumEntries; ++i )
07239         {
07240             // Here we are rendering one line at a time
07241             rc.bottom = rc.top + nSingleLineHeight;
07242             // Use a different color for the selected string
07243             if( s_CandList.dwSelection == i )
07244             {
07245                 m_pDialog->DrawRect( &rc, SelBkColor );
07246                 m_Elements.GetAt( 1 )->FontColor.Current = SelTextColor;
07247             } else
07248                 m_Elements.GetAt( 1 )->FontColor.Current = TextColor;
07249 
07250             m_pDialog->DrawText( s_CandList.awszCandidate[i], m_Elements.GetAt( 1 ), &rc );
07251 
07252             rc.top += nSingleLineHeight;
07253         }
07254     } else
07255     {
07256         // Horizontal candidate window
07257         m_Elements.GetAt( 1 )->FontColor.Current = TextColor;
07258         if( bReading )
07259             m_pDialog->DrawText( s_wszReadingString, m_Elements.GetAt( 1 ), &rc );
07260         else
07261             m_pDialog->DrawText( s_CandList.HoriCand.GetBuffer(), m_Elements.GetAt( 1 ), &rc );
07262 
07263         // Render the selected entry differently
07264         if( !bReading )
07265         {
07266             int nXLeft, nXRight;
07267             s_CandList.HoriCand.CPtoX( s_CandList.nFirstSelected, FALSE, &nXLeft );
07268             s_CandList.HoriCand.CPtoX( s_CandList.nFirstSelected + s_CandList.nHoriSelectedLen, FALSE, &nXRight );
07269 
07270             rc.right = rc.left + nXRight;
07271             rc.left += nXLeft;
07272             m_pDialog->DrawRect( &rc, SelBkColor );
07273             m_Elements.GetAt( 1 )->FontColor.Current = SelTextColor;
07274             m_pDialog->DrawText( s_CandList.HoriCand.GetBuffer() + s_CandList.nFirstSelected,
07275                                 m_Elements.GetAt( 1 ), &rc, false, s_CandList.nHoriSelectedLen );
07276         }
07277     }
07278 }
07279 
07280 
07281 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07282 void CDXUTIMEEditBox::RenderComposition( IDirect3DDevice9* pd3dDevice, float fElapsedTime )
07283 {
07284     RECT rcCaret = { 0, 0, 0, 0 };
07285     int nX, nXFirst;
07286     m_Buffer.CPtoX( m_nCaret, FALSE, &nX );
07287     m_Buffer.CPtoX( m_nFirstVisible, FALSE, &nXFirst );
07288     CDXUTElement *pElement = m_Elements.GetAt( 1 );
07289 
07290     // Get the required width
07291     RECT rc = { m_rcText.left + nX - nXFirst, m_rcText.top,
07292                 m_rcText.left + nX - nXFirst, m_rcText.bottom };
07293     m_pDialog->CalcTextRect( s_CompString.GetBuffer(), pElement, &rc );
07294 
07295     // If the composition string is too long to fit within
07296     // the text area, move it to below the current line.
07297     // This matches the behavior of the default IME.
07298     if( rc.right > m_rcText.right )
07299         OffsetRect( &rc, m_rcText.left - rc.left, rc.bottom - rc.top );
07300 
07301     // Save the rectangle position for processing highlighted text.
07302     RECT rcFirst = rc;
07303 
07304     // Update s_ptCompString for RenderCandidateReadingWindow().
07305     s_ptCompString.x = rc.left; s_ptCompString.y = rc.top;
07306 
07307     D3DCOLOR TextColor = m_CompColor;
07308     // Render the window and string.
07309     // If the string is too long, we must wrap the line.
07310     pElement->FontColor.Current = TextColor;
07311     const WCHAR *pwszComp = s_CompString.GetBuffer();
07312     int nCharLeft = s_CompString.GetTextSize();
07313     for( ; ; )
07314     {
07315         // Find the last character that can be drawn on the same line.
07316         int nLastInLine;
07317         int bTrail;
07318         s_CompString.XtoCP( m_rcText.right - rc.left, &nLastInLine, &bTrail );
07319         int nNumCharToDraw = __min( nCharLeft, nLastInLine );
07320         m_pDialog->CalcTextRect( pwszComp, pElement, &rc, nNumCharToDraw );
07321 
07322         // Draw the background
07323         // For Korean IME, blink the composition window background as if it
07324         // is a cursor.
07325         if( GetPrimaryLanguage() == LANG_KOREAN )
07326         {
07327             if( m_bCaretOn )
07328             {
07329                 m_pDialog->DrawRect( &rc, m_CompWinColor );
07330             }
07331             else
07332             {
07333                 // Not drawing composition string background. We
07334                 // use the editbox's text color for composition
07335                 // string text.
07336                 TextColor = m_Elements.GetAt(0)->FontColor.States[DXUT_STATE_NORMAL];
07337             }
07338         } else
07339         {
07340             // Non-Korean IME. Always draw composition background.
07341             m_pDialog->DrawRect( &rc, m_CompWinColor );
07342         }
07343 
07344         // Draw the text
07345         pElement->FontColor.Current = TextColor;
07346         m_pDialog->DrawText( pwszComp, pElement, &rc, false, nNumCharToDraw );
07347 
07348         // Advance pointer and counter
07349         nCharLeft -= nNumCharToDraw;
07350         pwszComp += nNumCharToDraw;
07351         if( nCharLeft <= 0 )
07352             break;
07353 
07354         // Advance rectangle coordinates to beginning of next line
07355         OffsetRect( &rc, m_rcText.left - rc.left, rc.bottom - rc.top );
07356     }
07357 
07358     // Load the rect for the first line again.
07359     rc = rcFirst;
07360 
07361     // Inspect each character in the comp string.
07362     // For target-converted and target-non-converted characters,
07363     // we display a different background color so they appear highlighted.
07364     int nCharFirst = 0;
07365     nXFirst = 0;
07366     s_nFirstTargetConv = -1;
07367     BYTE *pAttr;
07368     const WCHAR *pcComp;
07369     for( pcComp = s_CompString.GetBuffer(), pAttr = s_abCompStringAttr;
07370           *pcComp != L'\0'; ++pcComp, ++pAttr )
07371     {
07372         D3DCOLOR bkColor;
07373 
07374         // Render a different background for this character
07375         int nXLeft, nXRight;
07376         s_CompString.CPtoX( int(pcComp - s_CompString.GetBuffer()), FALSE, &nXLeft );
07377         s_CompString.CPtoX( int(pcComp - s_CompString.GetBuffer()), TRUE, &nXRight );
07378 
07379         // Check if this character is off the right edge and should
07380         // be wrapped to the next line.
07381         if( nXRight - nXFirst > m_rcText.right - rc.left )
07382         {
07383             // Advance rectangle coordinates to beginning of next line
07384             OffsetRect( &rc, m_rcText.left - rc.left, rc.bottom - rc.top );
07385 
07386             // Update the line's first character information
07387             nCharFirst = int(pcComp - s_CompString.GetBuffer());
07388             s_CompString.CPtoX( nCharFirst, FALSE, &nXFirst );
07389         }
07390 
07391         // If the caret is on this character, save the coordinates
07392         // for drawing the caret later.
07393         if( s_nCompCaret == int(pcComp - s_CompString.GetBuffer()) )
07394         {
07395             rcCaret = rc;
07396             rcCaret.left += nXLeft - nXFirst - 1;
07397             rcCaret.right = rcCaret.left + 2;
07398         }
07399 
07400         // Set up color based on the character attribute
07401         if( *pAttr == ATTR_TARGET_CONVERTED )
07402         {
07403             pElement->FontColor.Current = m_CompTargetColor;
07404             bkColor = m_CompTargetBkColor;
07405         }
07406         else
07407         if( *pAttr == ATTR_TARGET_NOTCONVERTED )
07408         {
07409             pElement->FontColor.Current = m_CompTargetNonColor;
07410             bkColor = m_CompTargetNonBkColor;
07411         }
07412         else
07413         {
07414             continue;
07415         }
07416 
07417         RECT rcTarget = { rc.left + nXLeft - nXFirst, rc.top, rc.left + nXRight - nXFirst, rc.bottom };
07418         m_pDialog->DrawRect( &rcTarget, bkColor );
07419         m_pDialog->DrawText( pcComp, pElement, &rcTarget, false, 1 );
07420 
07421         // Record the first target converted character's index
07422         if( -1 == s_nFirstTargetConv )
07423             s_nFirstTargetConv = int(pAttr - s_abCompStringAttr);
07424     }
07425 
07426     // Render the composition caret
07427     if( m_bCaretOn )
07428     {
07429         // If the caret is at the very end, its position would not have
07430         // been computed in the above loop.  We compute it here.
07431         if( s_nCompCaret == s_CompString.GetTextSize() )
07432         {
07433             s_CompString.CPtoX( s_nCompCaret, FALSE, &nX );
07434             rcCaret = rc;
07435             rcCaret.left += nX - nXFirst - 1;
07436             rcCaret.right = rcCaret.left + 2;
07437         }
07438 
07439         m_pDialog->DrawRect( &rcCaret, m_CompCaretColor );
07440     }
07441 }
07442 
07443 
07444 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07445 void CDXUTIMEEditBox::RenderIndicator( IDirect3DDevice9* pd3dDevice, float fElapsedTime )
07446 {
07447     CDXUTElement *pElement = m_Elements.GetAt( 9 );
07448     pElement->TextureColor.Blend( DXUT_STATE_NORMAL, fElapsedTime );
07449 
07450     m_pDialog->DrawSprite( pElement, &m_rcIndicator );
07451     RECT rc = m_rcIndicator;
07452     InflateRect( &rc, -m_nSpacing, -m_nSpacing );
07453     pElement->FontColor.Current = s_ImeState == IMEUI_STATE_ON && s_bEnableImeSystem ? m_IndicatorImeColor : m_IndicatorEngColor;
07454     RECT rcCalc = { 0, 0, 0, 0 };
07455     // If IME system is off, draw English indicator.
07456     WCHAR *pwszIndicator = s_bEnableImeSystem ? s_wszCurrIndicator : s_aszIndicator[0];
07457 
07458     m_pDialog->CalcTextRect( pwszIndicator, pElement, &rcCalc );
07459     m_pDialog->DrawText( pwszIndicator, pElement, &rc );
07460 }
07461 
07462 
07463 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07464 void CDXUTIMEEditBox::Render( IDirect3DDevice9* pd3dDevice, float fElapsedTime )
07465 {
07466     if( m_bVisible == false )
07467         return;
07468 
07469     // If we have not computed the indicator symbol width,
07470     // do it.
07471     if( !m_nIndicatorWidth )
07472     {
07473         for( int i = 0; i < 5; ++i )
07474         {
07475             RECT rc = { 0, 0, 0, 0 };
07476             m_pDialog->CalcTextRect( s_aszIndicator[i], m_Elements.GetAt( 9 ), &rc );
07477             m_nIndicatorWidth = __max( m_nIndicatorWidth, rc.right - rc.left );
07478         }
07479         // Update the rectangles now that we have the indicator's width
07480         UpdateRects();
07481     }
07482 
07483     // Let the parent render first (edit control)
07484     CDXUTEditBox::Render( pd3dDevice, fElapsedTime );
07485 
07486     CDXUTElement* pElement = GetElement( 1 );
07487     if( pElement )
07488     {
07489         s_CompString.SetFontNode( m_pDialog->GetFont( pElement->iFont ) );
07490         s_CandList.HoriCand.SetFontNode( m_pDialog->GetFont( pElement->iFont ) );
07491     }
07492 
07493     //
07494     // Now render the IME elements
07495     //
07496     if( m_bHasFocus )
07497     {
07498         // Render the input locale indicator
07499         RenderIndicator( pd3dDevice, fElapsedTime );
07500 
07501         // Display the composition string.
07502         // This method should also update s_ptCompString
07503         // for RenderCandidateReadingWindow.
07504         RenderComposition( pd3dDevice, fElapsedTime );
07505 
07506         // Display the reading/candidate window. RenderCandidateReadingWindow()
07507         // uses s_ptCompString to position itself.  s_ptCompString must have
07508         // been filled in by RenderComposition().
07509         if( s_bShowReadingWindow )
07510             // Reading window
07511             RenderCandidateReadingWindow( pd3dDevice, fElapsedTime, true );
07512         else
07513         if( s_CandList.bShowWindow )
07514             // Candidate list window
07515             RenderCandidateReadingWindow( pd3dDevice, fElapsedTime, false );
07516     }
07517 }
07518 
07519 
07520 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07521 void CUniBuffer::Initialize()
07522 {
07523     if( s_hDll ) // Only need to do once
07524         return;
07525 
07526     WCHAR wszPath[MAX_PATH+1];
07527     if( !::GetSystemDirectory( wszPath, MAX_PATH+1 ) )
07528         return;
07529 
07530     // Verify whether it is safe to concatenate these strings
07531     int len1 = lstrlen(wszPath);
07532     int len2 = lstrlen(UNISCRIBE_DLLNAME);
07533     if (len1 + len2 > MAX_PATH)
07534     {
07535         return;
07536     }
07537 
07538     // We have verified that the concatenated string will fit into wszPath,
07539     // so it is safe to concatenate them.
07540     StringCchCat( wszPath, MAX_PATH, UNISCRIBE_DLLNAME );
07541 
07542     s_hDll = LoadLibrary( wszPath );
07543     if( s_hDll )
07544     {
07545         FARPROC Temp;
07546         GETPROCADDRESS( s_hDll, ScriptApplyDigitSubstitution, Temp );
07547         GETPROCADDRESS( s_hDll, ScriptStringAnalyse, Temp );
07548         GETPROCADDRESS( s_hDll, ScriptStringCPtoX, Temp );
07549         GETPROCADDRESS( s_hDll, ScriptStringXtoCP, Temp );
07550         GETPROCADDRESS( s_hDll, ScriptStringFree, Temp );
07551         GETPROCADDRESS( s_hDll, ScriptString_pLogAttr, Temp );
07552         GETPROCADDRESS( s_hDll, ScriptString_pcOutChars, Temp );
07553     }
07554 }
07555 
07556 
07557 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07558 void CUniBuffer::Uninitialize()
07559 {
07560     if( s_hDll )
07561     {
07562         PLACEHOLDERPROC( ScriptApplyDigitSubstitution );
07563         PLACEHOLDERPROC( ScriptStringAnalyse );
07564         PLACEHOLDERPROC( ScriptStringCPtoX );
07565         PLACEHOLDERPROC( ScriptStringXtoCP );
07566         PLACEHOLDERPROC( ScriptStringFree );
07567         PLACEHOLDERPROC( ScriptString_pLogAttr );
07568         PLACEHOLDERPROC( ScriptString_pcOutChars );
07569 
07570         FreeLibrary( s_hDll );
07571         s_hDll = NULL;
07572     }
07573 }

07576 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07577 bool CUniBuffer::SetBufferSize( int nNewSize )
07578 {
07579     // If the current size is already the maximum allowed,
07580     // we can't possibly allocate more.
07581     if( m_nBufferSize == DXUT_MAX_EDITBOXLENGTH )
07582         return false;
07583 
07584     int nAllocateSize = ( nNewSize == -1 || nNewSize < m_nBufferSize * 2 ) ? ( m_nBufferSize ? m_nBufferSize * 2 : 256 ) : nNewSize * 2;
07585 
07586     // Cap the buffer size at the maximum allowed.
07587     if( nAllocateSize > DXUT_MAX_EDITBOXLENGTH )
07588         nAllocateSize = DXUT_MAX_EDITBOXLENGTH;
07589 
07590     WCHAR *pTempBuffer = DX_NEW WCHAR[nAllocateSize];
07591     if( !pTempBuffer )
07592         return false;
07593     if( m_pwszBuffer )
07594     {
07595         CopyMemory( pTempBuffer, m_pwszBuffer, m_nBufferSize * sizeof(WCHAR) );
07596         delete[] m_pwszBuffer;
07597     }
07598     else
07599     {
07600         ZeroMemory( pTempBuffer, sizeof(WCHAR) * nAllocateSize );
07601     }
07602 
07603     m_pwszBuffer = pTempBuffer;
07604     m_nBufferSize = nAllocateSize;
07605     return true;
07606 }
07607 
07608 
07609 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07610 // Uniscribe -- Analyse() analyses the string in the buffer
07611 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07612 HRESULT CUniBuffer::Analyse()
07613 {
07614     if( m_Analysis )
07615         _ScriptStringFree( &m_Analysis );
07616 
07617     SCRIPT_CONTROL ScriptControl; // For uniscribe
07618     SCRIPT_STATE   ScriptState;   // For uniscribe
07619     ZeroMemory( &ScriptControl, sizeof(ScriptControl) );
07620     ZeroMemory( &ScriptState, sizeof(ScriptState) );
07621     _ScriptApplyDigitSubstitution ( NULL, &ScriptControl, &ScriptState );
07622 
07623     if( !m_pFontNode )
07624         return E_FAIL;
07625 
07626     HRESULT hr = _ScriptStringAnalyse( m_pFontNode->pFont ? m_pFontNode->pFont->GetDC() : NULL,
07627                                        m_pwszBuffer,
07628                                        lstrlenW( m_pwszBuffer ) + 1,  // NULL is also analyzed.
07629                                        lstrlenW( m_pwszBuffer ) * 3 / 2 + 16,
07630                                        -1,
07631                                        SSA_BREAK | SSA_GLYPHS | SSA_FALLBACK | SSA_LINK,
07632                                        0,
07633                                        &ScriptControl,
07634                                        &ScriptState,
07635                                        NULL,
07636                                        NULL,
07637                                        NULL,
07638                                        &m_Analysis );
07639     if( SUCCEEDED( hr ) )
07640         m_bAnalyseRequired = false;  // Analysis is up-to-date
07641     return hr;
07642 }
07643

07647 {
07648     CUniBuffer::Initialize();  // ensure static vars are properly init'ed first
07649 
07650     m_nBufferSize = 0;
07651     m_pwszBuffer = NULL;
07652     m_bAnalyseRequired = true;
07653     m_Analysis = NULL;
07654     m_pFontNode = NULL;
07655     
07656     if( nInitialSize > 0 )
07657         SetBufferSize( nInitialSize );
07658 }

07672 {

07675     // re-analysis is required.
07676     m_bAnalyseRequired = true;
07677     return m_pwszBuffer[n];
