07689 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07690 // Inserts the char at specified index.
07691 // If nIndex == -1, insert to the end.
07692 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07693 bool CUniBuffer::InsertChar( int nIndex, WCHAR wChar )
07694 {
07695     assert( nIndex >= 0 );
07696 
07697     if( nIndex < 0 || nIndex > lstrlenW( m_pwszBuffer ) )
07698         return false;  // invalid index
07699 
07700     // Check for maximum length allowed
07701     if( GetTextSize() + 1 >= DXUT_MAX_EDITBOXLENGTH )
07702         return false;
07703 
07704     if( lstrlenW( m_pwszBuffer ) + 1 >= m_nBufferSize )
07705     {
07706         if( !SetBufferSize( -1 ) )
07707             return false;  // out of memory
07708     }
07709 
07710     assert( m_nBufferSize >= 2 );
07711 
07712     // Shift the characters after the index, start by copying the null terminator
07713     WCHAR* dest = m_pwszBuffer + lstrlenW(m_pwszBuffer)+1;
07714     WCHAR* stop = m_pwszBuffer + nIndex;
07715     WCHAR* src = dest - 1;
07716 
07717     while( dest > stop )
07718     {
07719         *dest-- = *src--;
07720     }
07721 
07722     // Set new character
07723     m_pwszBuffer[ nIndex ] = wChar;
07724     m_bAnalyseRequired = true;
07725 
07726     return true;
07727 }
07728 
07729 
07730 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07731 // Removes the char at specified index.
07732 // If nIndex == -1, remove the last char.
07733 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07734 bool CUniBuffer::RemoveChar( int nIndex )
07735 {
07736     if( !lstrlenW( m_pwszBuffer ) || nIndex < 0 || nIndex >= lstrlenW( m_pwszBuffer ) )
07737         return false;  // Invalid index
07738 
07739     MoveMemory( m_pwszBuffer + nIndex, m_pwszBuffer + nIndex + 1, sizeof(WCHAR) * ( lstrlenW( m_pwszBuffer ) - nIndex ) );
07740     m_bAnalyseRequired = true;
07741     return true;
07742 }
07743 
07744 
07745 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07746 // Inserts the first nCount characters of the string pStr at specified index.
07747 // If nCount == -1, the entire string is inserted.
07748 // If nIndex == -1, insert to the end.
07749 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07750 bool CUniBuffer::InsertString( int nIndex, const WCHAR *pStr, int nCount )
07751 {
07752     assert( nIndex >= 0 );
07753 
07754     if( nIndex > lstrlenW( m_pwszBuffer ) )
07755         return false;  // invalid index
07756 
07757     if( -1 == nCount )
07758         nCount = lstrlenW( pStr );
07759 
07760     // Check for maximum length allowed
07761     if( GetTextSize() + nCount >= DXUT_MAX_EDITBOXLENGTH )
07762         return false;
07763 
07764     if( lstrlenW( m_pwszBuffer ) + nCount >= m_nBufferSize )
07765     {
07766         if( !SetBufferSize( lstrlenW( m_pwszBuffer ) + nCount + 1 ) )
07767             return false;  // out of memory
07768     }
07769 
07770     MoveMemory( m_pwszBuffer + nIndex + nCount, m_pwszBuffer + nIndex, sizeof(WCHAR) * ( lstrlenW( m_pwszBuffer ) - nIndex + 1 ) );
07771     CopyMemory( m_pwszBuffer + nIndex, pStr, nCount * sizeof(WCHAR) );
07772     m_bAnalyseRequired = true;
07773 
07774     return true;
07775 }
07776 
07777 
07778 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07779 bool CUniBuffer::SetText( LPCWSTR wszText )
07780 {
07781     assert( wszText != NULL );
07782 
07783     int nRequired = int(wcslen( wszText ) + 1);
07784 
07785     // Check for maximum length allowed
07786     if( nRequired >= DXUT_MAX_EDITBOXLENGTH )
07787         return false;
07788 
07789     while( GetBufferSize() < nRequired )
07790         if( !SetBufferSize( -1 ) )
07791             break;
07792     // Check again in case out of memory occurred inside while loop.
07793     if( GetBufferSize() >= nRequired )
07794     {
07795         StringCchCopy( m_pwszBuffer, GetBufferSize(), wszText );
07796         m_bAnalyseRequired = true;
07797         return true;
07798     }
07799     else
07800         return false;
07801 }

07804 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07805 HRESULT CUniBuffer::CPtoX( int nCP, BOOL bTrail, int *pX )
07806 {
07807     assert( pX );
07808     *pX = 0;  // Default
07809 
07810     HRESULT hr = S_OK;
07811     if( m_bAnalyseRequired )
07812         hr = Analyse();
07813 
07814     if( SUCCEEDED( hr ) )
07815         hr = _ScriptStringCPtoX( m_Analysis, nCP, bTrail, pX );
07816 
07817     return hr;
07818 }
07819 
07820 
07821 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07822 HRESULT CUniBuffer::XtoCP( int nX, int *pCP, int *pnTrail )
07823 {
07824     assert( pCP && pnTrail );
07825     *pCP = 0; *pnTrail = FALSE;  // Default
07826 
07827     HRESULT hr = S_OK;
07828     if( m_bAnalyseRequired )
07829         hr = Analyse();
07830 
07831     if( SUCCEEDED( hr ) )
07832         hr = _ScriptStringXtoCP( m_Analysis, nX, pCP, pnTrail );
07833 
07834     // If the coordinate falls outside the text region, we
07835     // can get character positions that don't exist.  We must
07836     // filter them here and convert them to those that do exist.
07837     if( *pCP == -1 && *pnTrail == TRUE )
07838     {
07839         *pCP = 0; *pnTrail = FALSE;
07840     } else
07841     if( *pCP > lstrlenW( m_pwszBuffer ) && *pnTrail == FALSE )
07842     {
07843         *pCP = lstrlenW( m_pwszBuffer ); *pnTrail = TRUE;
07844     }
07845 
07846     return hr;
07847 }

07850 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07851 void CUniBuffer::GetPriorItemPos( int nCP, int *pPrior )
07852 {
07853     *pPrior = nCP;  // Default is the char itself
07854 
07855     if( m_bAnalyseRequired )
07856         if( FAILED( Analyse() ) )
07857             return;
07858 
07859     const SCRIPT_LOGATTR *pLogAttr = _ScriptString_pLogAttr( m_Analysis );
07860     if( !pLogAttr )
07861         return;
07862 
07863     if( !_ScriptString_pcOutChars( m_Analysis ) )
07864         return;
07865     int nInitial = *_ScriptString_pcOutChars( m_Analysis );
07866     if( nCP - 1 < nInitial )
07867         nInitial = nCP - 1;
07868     for( int i = nInitial; i > 0; --i )
07869         if( pLogAttr[i].fWordStop ||       // Either the fWordStop flag is set
07870             ( !pLogAttr[i].fWhiteSpace &&  // Or the previous char is whitespace but this isn't.
07871                 pLogAttr[i-1].fWhiteSpace ) )
07872         {
07873             *pPrior = i;
07874             return;
07875         }
07876     // We have reached index 0.  0 is always a break point, so simply return it.
07877     *pPrior = 0;
07878 }
07879     
07880 
07881 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07882 void CUniBuffer::GetNextItemPos( int nCP, int *pPrior )
07883 {
07884     *pPrior = nCP;  // Default is the char itself
07885 
07886     HRESULT hr = S_OK;
07887     if( m_bAnalyseRequired )
07888         hr = Analyse();
07889     if( FAILED( hr ) )
07890         return;
07891 
07892     const SCRIPT_LOGATTR *pLogAttr = _ScriptString_pLogAttr( m_Analysis );
07893     if( !pLogAttr )
07894         return;
07895 
07896     if( !_ScriptString_pcOutChars( m_Analysis ) )
07897         return;
07898     int nInitial = *_ScriptString_pcOutChars( m_Analysis );
07899     if( nCP + 1 < nInitial )
07900         nInitial = nCP + 1;
07901     for( int i = nInitial; i < *_ScriptString_pcOutChars( m_Analysis ) - 1; ++i )
07902     {
07903         if( pLogAttr[i].fWordStop )      // Either the fWordStop flag is set
07904         {
07905             *pPrior = i;
07906             return;
07907         }
07908         else
07909         if( pLogAttr[i].fWhiteSpace &&  // Or this whitespace but the next char isn't.
07910             !pLogAttr[i+1].fWhiteSpace )
07911         {
07912             *pPrior = i+1;  // The next char is a word stop
07913             return;
07914         }
07915     }
07916     // We have reached the end. It's always a word stop, so simply return it.
07917     *pPrior = *_ScriptString_pcOutChars( m_Analysis ) - 1;
07918 }

08031 void DXUTBlendColor::Init( D3DCOLOR defaultColor, D3DCOLOR disabledColor, D3DCOLOR hiddenColor )
08032 {

08034     {
08035         States[ i ] = defaultColor;
08036     }
08037 
08038     States[ DXUT_STATE_DISABLED ] = disabledColor;
08039     States[ DXUT_STATE_HIDDEN ] = hiddenColor;
08040     Current = hiddenColor;

08044 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08045 void DXUTBlendColor::Blend( UINT iState, float fElapsedTime, float fRate )
08046 {
08047     D3DXCOLOR destColor = States[ iState ];
08048     D3DXColorLerp( &Current, &Current, &destColor, 1.0f - powf( fRate, 30 * fElapsedTime ) );
08049 }
